name: Luxury studio 'Spiegelhof' in the centre of Ghent
description:
The top floor of our house in the center of Ghent is a tasteful and practically furnished studio with a separate sleeping area, sitting area, dining area and kitchenette. There is a private bathroom with rain shower, sink and toilet. The studio is equipped with all amenities and comfort.
You can use the cozy terrace located on the mezzanine floor. There is a sofa with cushions, mood lighting and a low table. Ideal for breakfast or an aperitif.
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a quiet and pleasant neighborhood within walking distance of the historic city center. The historic center of Ghent is within walking distance of our house. After a busy day you can enjoy your own studio in peace and quiet. The room has recently been insulated. You are not bothered by outside noise.
There is a supermarket around the corner and a bakery on the church square.
There are several restaurants within walking distance.
host_about: We are living in a house in the center of beautifull Ghent. Just a 10 minutes walk away from the historical center. We like traveling to cities. It will be a pleasure to be the host of travellers who vist Ghent or other cities in Belgium. We are very interested in cultural activities. Ghent offers a unique choice of cultural activities: musea, concerthall's, cinemas, opera, expositions,... We will offer you a warm welcome en hope you enjoy your stay.

name: Flat close to Sint-Pieters Station!
description: This well-located and comfortable one-bedroom flat on the ground floor of a city house allows you to discover Ghent at ease, whether you come by train or car. The heart of the city is at walking distance while you sleep in a quiet street.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located in a dead-end street - so it is quiet and no traffic is passing through, especially in weekends and evenings. There is a square in front of the house with parking facilities.

There are bakeries, restaurants and shops in the vicinity. A nice restaurant with take-away facilities is just around the corner. And the heart of the city is a stroll away along the river.

If you want to go for sports (jogging, out or indoor swimming) and nature/relaxation, you can walk to the Blaarmeersen which has all major sports facilities.
host_about: I am a legal advisor who always worked internationally and used to travel extensively. Keen on meeting people, I like to assist newcomers in discovering my home town both for their professional or private reasons. I expect guests to have a certain maturity and to communicate with mutual respect.

name: Large & bright town House - Center Ghent - max 8p
description:
bright, spacious, authentic & beautifully restaured townhouse in the center of ghent. close to the historical & actual hightlights and most trending places :)
Quiet and creative area, close to small local shops, fresh markets, city supermarkets, bakeries, restaurants, coffee bars, authentic very local pubs. public transport 3' walking distance
neighborhood_overview: our neighbourhood known as GENT LINKEROEVER is quiet, but nicely vibrating due to the gentle mix of small local independent shops, restaurants, coffee bars and the best local pubs, but also residents of all ages & origins and of course our amazing students around :)
host_about:
hi, I'm an interior designer, I live and work in Ghent and I love my city !
I'm renting the house next to mine for short rental stays and would be very happy to help anyone who wants to discover Ghent.
of course travelling & exploring new countries/cities is one of my passions :)

name: Basic room in a 19th century house near station.
description:
Only a short walk to the old city center and close to several of Ghent's beautiful parks.

There is parking near the house and bike rental options.

Although the house is located in a very vivid area of town, you can enjoy the peacefulness and quietness at all times as the rooms are located in the back of the house, with a view of the large garden.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located between the 'Visserij', 'Macharius' and 'Dampoort' area. Dampoort neighbourhood is known for the its intercultural live and atmosphere. There is a lot of greenery, what you don't often see in the city because Ghent is rated as one of the 'greyest' cities in the world :-). You have at least five small and big parks around the house where you can go to relax or where you have public BBQ sets.

The 'Visserij' and 'Macharius' are mainly populated by young people and young families. There is lots of restaurants and several cozy local bars here.
host_about:
I'm a mother of one year old twins, renting out a room in our own family home. Ghent can be crowded, and so can be the hotels and hostels, therefore I see renting out a part of my private house as a great opportunity for both guest and host. But for obvious reasons we do not allow party people, extra guests, pets,... 
We respect guests and expect respect (silence and cleanliness) in return!

name: Black & White studioB central Ghent
description:
This is a new self-catered studio situated in a hip upcoming neighbourhood of the center of Ghent.
Ideal for 1 person or couple. Erasmus or PHD student.
With private kitchen and bathroom (shower, toilet, lavabo). Fully furnished and equipped kitchen.
neighborhood_overview: This studio is situated in a hip upcoming neighbourhood of the center of Ghent. A lot of alternative nice bars and restaurants nearby. Bakery shop around the corner and several locations for a nice breakfast. Shopping area at 3 min walk. Historical center with the 3 famous towers are only 5 min walk along a beautiful canal. On sunday morning there is a book- and flower market at the end of the street.
host_about: We like to invite open minded people in our accommodations from all over the world to share thoughts. And learn you all about the beautiful unknown spots in our city.

name: Perfect apartment centre of Ghent
description:
We offer you an apartment in the Oude Houtlei 13C. The flat is located in the heart of the old city at 5 minutes walking distance of the Graslei and Korenlei and the Castle Gravensteen but still the location is very quiet.
The apartment is situated in an old schoolbuilding that has recently been renovated with respect for the old details. With its high windows facing south is an oasis of light and space.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is situated in the heart of the old city, Oude Houtlei Gent. The flat is located at 5 minutes walking distance from the Graslei, Korenlei, the Sint Baafscathedral and the Castle Gravensteen.
There is absolutely everything in the neighborhood at max 5 minutes walking distance : cinema, restaurants, postoffice, shops, supermarket, busstation, public parking, ...

name: Huis van Vletingen downtown apartment Ghent
description:
Modern, cosy and stylishly equipped flat with all comforts and kitchen. Located in a quiet and pleasant neighbourhood. Park your car right outside the door while being perfectly located to the bustling city centre.
Feel free to move from your new base with our two bikes. This way you will not only discover the idyllic spots in the suburbs but also the nearby nature.
neighborhood_overview:
Discover the heart of Ghent, located in a charming neighborhood near South Park and easily accessible. This location is simply perfect, whether you’re planning a short or long stay to fully enjoy all that Ghent has to offer.

All major attractions are just a short walk away, and in about 10 minutes, you’ll find yourself in the bustling city center. Prefer public transport? No problem— all major bus and tram connections are just 100 meters from your door.

Ghent is a beautiful city full of historic charm and unique ambiance. Picturesque buildings, cozy squares, winding rivers, and lovely parks invite you to explore. In this city, which you can easily cross on foot in an hour, you’ll discover a world of shops, boutiques, museums, eateries, restaurants, lively cafés, and nightlife. Ghent is alive, and you’ll want to be right at its heart.

With its central location, Ghent is also the perfect base for visiting other cities like Bruges, Brussels, Antwerp, and e
host_about:
I'm an open minded, very busy entrepreneur who like to make things convenient for other people.

I'm curious about other cultures, I love to travel to Thailand.

Before I was a real party animal, nowadays I'm more into dining and wining with friends or easy at home.

My favorite seven lovely logics:

1. Make Peace with your Past so it doesn’t spoil your Present.
2. What others Think of you is None of your Business.
3. Time Heals Almost Everything, Give the Time, Some Time.
4. No one is the Reason of your Happiness Except You yourself.
5. Don’t compare your Life with others, You have No Idea what their journey is all about.
6. Stop Thinking too much, It’s alright not to know all the Answers.
7. Smile, you don’t own all the Problems in the World.

name: Heaven@11, your charming studio in historic Gent.
description: A white house on a quiet street in a medieval quarter, Number 11 offers private accommodation in the fascinating historical town of Gent. Two self-contained units* - '11 Apa Above' and '11 Studio below' - can be booked together or separately. Your studio is on the ground floor.
neighborhood_overview:
Located right in the middle of Gent's historic center of 'Patershol' : an exciting and cosy neighbourhood, little alleys, medieval streets and castle.

The Patershol quarter is the medieval heart of the city. The Friary of the Calced Carmelites, dating back to 1329, was fully restored at the end of the last century and reopened as an exhibion space. Thirty years ago, you could buy a little house here for next to nothing. Today, the Patershol is one of the city’s most desirable neighbourhoods. For good dining, you can choose from one of the many restaurants which have sprung up in the medieval alleys. From Japanese to Thai, to delicious traditional Flemish cooking, you’ll find everything here. - See more at: http://www.visitgent.be/en/patershol?context=tourist#sthash.qkx4eI46.dpuf
host_about:
P Roelens, interior architect.
K Vandekerkhove, visual communication

description: Our apartment on Belfortstreet is located on the corner of Vlasmarkt, right next to Sint Jacobs which puts in right in the middle of the of vibrant, historic Ghent. At  walking distance of Gent Dampoort train station, close to all tourist attractions, bike rental and with a very good connection to public transport. Hungry of thirsty? neighborhood_overview: No shortage of markets and entertainment in the vibrant city centre. name: Small loft + private bathroom
description: We offer a back house with studio, private toilet and private bathroom. All newly installed, well isolated and very private. Connected with main house through a veranda which you can use to relax, our back-house is ideal for short and mid-term stays. Leave your car and hop on the tram (at 100m) or walk to discover an alternative Ghent.
neighborhood_overview:
Ledeberg is a popular neighborhood of Ghent (though our street is very peaceful). It offers fast access to the city centre, swift connections to public transport and bycicle-lanes. Think of us as being a comfortable hub to a great city. Also enjoy our Sundaymorning market and take advantage of the many shops, Belgian fries, take-aways (Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, Turkish) & small restaurants. Excellent 'Delhaize' supermarket at 100 m. Explore alternative walks to Ghent city centre & discover wonderful sites & sights.

Prepare your visit to Ghent, check the official City website (also in EN) "visit gent".
host_about:
Me, my wife and our 16yo daughter enjoy the company of travelers.
Having traveled around the globe we understand your needs and we are glad to help you, in the first place by offering a warm, clean and comfortable stay.
We know and understand the artistic, progressive and alternative aspects of Ghent from the inside and are glad to introduce you or put you on your way to explore.

name: Lounge in the Intimate Urban Garden at a Retro Getaway
description: Explore the nearby design museum, then take it easy at this breezy, open-concept retreat looking out into the courtyard garden. Vintage wooden furniture makes for mid-century style and a warm ambiance, while white decor keeps things fresh.
neighborhood_overview: The house is situated in a residential area in the heart of old Ghent with its wonderful old buildings and museums. The Counts Castle is a 5-minute walk away and the famous medieval neighborhood of Patershol has lots of restaurants to explore.
host_about:
Hello, I m Nina. I have a cute family: Jan, my husband, our two daughters and our son.
We are designers who love to gather nice things around us. We also love visiting flea markets and looking for treasures.
Living in the center of Ghent and being surrounded by all those nice old buildings is amazing! Its such a privilege to live close to our friends and family. 
Ghent has been ranked as the third most authentic city in the world by National Geographic. We're sure you'll love it too.

Start the day with a rain shower and a cup of coffee or do you want to work in the garden on the laptop? It's delightful staying in midiSud…

name: Entrée d'Artistes@GhentHistoricalCentre
description: Sunny, popular, cozy, small studio ideal for 1 person with the advantage: the B&B is located in the center of Ghent. All amenities: private shower, toilet (next to the room), microwave, refrigerator..., ideal for the individual traveler. If necessary, a 2nd single bed-discreetly stored under the bed-can be placed next to it, although this will reduce the living space. In that case,please add 2 people when booking.The Patershol, starts at the end of the street. Common main entrance (front door).
neighborhood_overview:
Centre of Ghent: one of the most beautiful places to be.
A very lively area in the centre of Ghent, 100-600m away from the Patershol, the shoppingstreet Lange Munt, all historical attraction such as the Gravensteen, Vrijdagsmarkt, Graslei, Korenmarkt, etc. etc.. In the immediate vicinity are several stores and bakeries as well as the numerous wonderful restaurants in the famous Patershol, the Turkish, Italian restaurants in the Sleepstraat, the wonderful restaurants on the Graslei, breakfast possibilities all only 5 minutes walking.
The shoppingstreet Lange Munt is also only 5 minutes walking. In short, the ideal location for a nice stay in the centre of beautiful Ghent.
host_about: U komt bij ons terecht in een creatief en muzikaal huis. Ik ben een gepassioneerde en gedreven violiste met heel wat eigen solistische en kamermuzische projecten naast mijn vaste plaats in de Opera.  Mijn hobby is mijn beroep en mijn beroep mijn hobby. Sinds 2019 studeer ik er nog een Bachelor Jazz bij. Naast muziek hou ik van alle vormen van kunst alsook de kunst van het leven zelf. Mijn twee zonen, (de ene zoon werkt aan een Phd en de andere zoon maakt deel uit van een zelfstandig verpleegkundig team), zijn beiden ook muzikaal begaafd, zij spelen gitaar en piano. In december trouwde ik voor de tweede maal met een topman. Hij werkt in het stafteam van Stad Gent, departement opvoeding, jeugd en onderwijs. Hij heeft een passie voor lekkere wijn, creatief koken, reizen en het is zalig leven met hem. Vijf dingen waar ik niet buiten kan: mijn kinderen, mijn man, familie, ouders, mijn viool, muziek in het algemeen, mijn huis dat volledig verbouwd is naar eigen smaak en onze "tempel" is waar we ons gelukkig voelen, mijn vrienden en sociale contacten, mijn computer. Mijn favoriete reisbestemmingen zijn  Schotland, Zwitserland, Frankrijk, Engeland, Zuid-Korea, Tenerife, Spanje. Ik hou van boeken over psychologie, boeken over muziek en kunst. Favoriete films zijn alle films van Lars von Trier, Andrej Tarkovski, "de andere film" in het algemeen, maar ik hou ook van James Bond films en "gemakkelijkere" films. Ik hou van Koreaans eten, van de Franse keuken, Italiaanse keuken, de goeie Belgische keuken en van alle lekkere gerechten die met liefde klaargemaakt zijn.

kouter

name: Cosy room in medieval house, centre
description:
How about staying in the heart of the old city of Ghent? Rolling over the street for the best morning coffee? In a small but cosy duplex apartment, with most of one floor for you?
Live like a local !
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is right in the historic heart of the city, across from the famous ‘Patershol', an old quarter with a closed street pattern preserved from the Middle Ages. It's buzzing with restaurant life, especially during weekends, so if you want to dine in this area on Fridays or Saturdays, make sure you make a reservation.
Walking south gets you in 5-10 minutes to the Gravensteen (castle), Design Museum, Huis van Alijn museum (in my street at 200m), Graslei, Korenlei, the Belfry and the Saint Bavo Cathedral (Sint-Baafskathedraal) holding the world famous : 'Adoration of the Mystic Lamb' by Hubert and Jan van Eyck. And so much more.
You will find my personal GUIDEBOOK (somewhere here) with recommended places and a short description.

If you have any special interests, just ask, I might know about it.
About disco bars and beers, I know very little. My specialties are art (contemporary foremost), photography, coffee, film (not the block busters though), anyth
host_about:
I'm a photographer, graphic designer, teacher in arts, story teller, art lover & lover, traveller, motorbiker, Eurasia-phile, queer, feminist, bon vivant, #elektrogirl — currently working on a global image and storytelling project *Move She Does* on trailblazing women and their vehicles.

name: Apartment with a view
description:
*Until July 2025 terrace works are in progress at the other side of the building. The parking lot will not be available, but there is a parking tower at 5 minutes walk (100€ per month). *
Apartment, less than 2 km from the historical center of Ghent. Superb view (sunset!) from the 12th floor.
Direct access from/to the motorways and anyhow very quiet.
Old fashioned 70-ties apartment with spacious living room with parquet floor and separate income and kitchen.
neighborhood_overview:
'Ghent is like Bruges, but alive'.
Check the the blog: "Who knew Ghent, Belgium was the prettiest city in the world?" on Americablog, from its founder John Aravosis. I couldn't describe it better.
The apartment was in the seventies the first breakout from the city center for middle class people. Still close to the center, but also close to highway exit (which was an asset at that time). The apartment is at the sunny backside. No annoyance from the main road at the front side and a wonderful view on the sunset.
There is a supermarket and a 'suburb center' at 500m.
host_about:
We are a Belgian couple that likes traveling, meeting new people. We love to share our apartment with airbnb. 
During our travels we emphasize on 'experiencing' rather than on 'visiting'.
We appreciate authenticity.

name: Room in nice appt 15min walk to centre, free bikes
description:
This nice apartment is situated close to the heart of the city. A beautiful place from which you can discover lovely Ghent. Included: 2 bikes, wifi, use of washing machine and dryer, towels, water, coffee & tea, access to the whole house.
I live there with my playful and sweet cuddly cat, Molly.

The city of Ghent taxes each guest older than 18 for 2,83 euro per day per person. This extra city tax has to be payed cash at the end of your stay.
neighborhood_overview: It is a quiet neighbourhood with a baker, pharmacist and a small shop. There's a nice burger restaurant (Jilles) and pizzeria with awesome pizzas (La Pizzeria) in Tentoonstellingslaan, a few minutes away. The apartment is  very close to cinema Kinepolis, heart of Film Fest Ghent in october.
host_about: I am a theatre and art lover, for work and passion. Crazy cat lady as well. I love reading, cooking, a glass of wine, international contacts and languages. Totally crazy about Berlin (where I have lived) and ... Ghent, something I can hopefully infect you with during your stay in Ghent.

name: Artist habitat in the center (6pax)
description: Stay at the 17th century house of graphic artist Gaby De Schepper in the historical heart of Ghent, “Patershol”, one of Belgium’s gourmet hotspots. The Duplex Apartment accommodates up to 6 persons. Free WIFI, private bath, toilet.
neighborhood_overview: The Patershol neighbourhood is one of the most authentic areas of town, littered with 300 year old houses, it literally breaths history. On top of dozens of fantastic restaurants, there are several galleries, museums just around the corner, with the 13th century Gravensteen castle and "Huis Van Alijn" being the highlights (the castle is visible from the Duplex apartment).
host_about: Graphic artist, art history professor, landscape design specialist and architecture geek. I am a big time traveler, love meeting new folks from all over the world. India is sort of my second home and through it I have cultivated a deep affinity towards various Asian forms of spiritualism. Never too old to learn!

name: B&B cozy whole apartment
description:
Cozy whole apartment with breakfast. It is located in a quiet neighborhood, just 20 min from the center with public transportation.

There are two cats in the house, so please be aware of any cat allergies.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is close to public transportation (tram and bus) 4 min walking, and only 4 tram stops to the main train station (Gent Sint-Pieters).
It is 20 min by bus to the historic center.
Because of the location, the apartment is the best location for a day trip to Brussels (30 min by train) or Bruges (25 min by train).
The apartment is a few steps away from the big supermarket Aldi.
Also the Ghent university hospital UZ is just 4 minutes walk.

Please notice that you can park your car in the street, it cost 3 euros for 24 hours. It's free between 19:00 and 09:00 (Sunday is totally free).
host_about:
I'm a dentist studying a master program in Ghent/Belgium, I'm decent . respectful polite  guy , I'm friendly and like to discover new things adventurous and like to meet and communicate with people.
   
 I like keeping my home warm and nice , because its where my head rests , and I'm glad to share my cozy home with other nice people , I try to treat my guests as my family and close friends and provide them the best care can be given .

name: Romantic boat in Gent
description: Romantic deck-house in Gent, 5 minutes from city centre. The original 1930's mahogany shippers' living space offers the comfort of a fully equiped appartment. A unique experience on water. Two bikes are available. Parking space at 50m.
neighborhood_overview: The Réjean  lays at a bicycle route between nature and city centre, both minutes away. 1km from heart of town.
host_about:
Hello, I'm Hans, I live on a former cargo ship in Gent and you are welcome to spend your holiday in the original shippers house, a cosy lovers nest with full privacy and equipment, located near the city centre. 2 bicycles available.

Salut, je m'appelle Hans, j'habite sur mon péniche à Gand et j'ai la maison original du marin disponible à louer pour votre vacance. Équipement est complète et tout privé. Le location est au bord du centre. 2 bicyclettes disponibles.

name: Charming & historic villa, garden + free! parking
description: Enjoy a stylish experience in our historic 1904 villa near St Pieter's Station, in the midst of the bustling museum district just 15 minutes' walk from the historic city centre. You rent the entire house and outbuildings and enjoy our beautiful peaceful garden with lounge set, trampoline and BBQ. The garden is a safe place for kids. Moreover, there is free parking on the driveway, which few other airbnbs in this city can offer. Welcome to our unique Villa Pater, a green oasis in beautiful Ghent.
neighborhood_overview:
Located in a quiet neighborhood near the train station Gent-Sint-Pieters this is your ideal base. Not only to discover the beauty of Ghent. Thanks to the train (at 2 minutes walk!) You are also in no time in the other Flemish cities such as Bruges (25 min), Antwerp (40 min) and Brussels (35 min). Paris, London or Amsterdam are only a few hours away too!

There is a lovely sunny garden of 700 square meters, wonderful place to relax in and romp. You can hear nothing from the busy city life and a big gate also gives a strong sense of privacy.

Everything is within walking distance: the many museums in the vicinity (STAM, SMAK, Museum of Fine Arts), the historic center and its monuments, the St Bavo's Cathedral, the opera, the theater, cinemas, shops, breakfast and coffee houses . We also offer you tips for the best and most charming restaurants in Ghent. For every budget.

For those who love sport and recreation: the new stadium of our national soccer champio
host_about: Hi there, fellow traveller! Thanks for choosing our house in Ghent. Together with my husband I've travelled all over the world. With our two children (11&14) we lived in China (Beijing) for 5 years and from there we discovered Asia. Then we moved to  the US (Washington DC and Menlo Park) for 4 years and from there we discovered the Americas. We published several books about our adventures. Now we're back in our amazing hometown Ghent, and from here we're (re)discovering the beauty of Europe. We used AirBnb all over the world, and that's why we' ld love to share Villa Pater with you, our beautiful little secret in Ghent.

eally quiet and green neighbourhood.
The house is at the end of a small street (only 2houses) so no traffic coming trough in the street.

Nice big recreation domain nearby (great for walking, sports, playground, swimming lake,...)

Hope to meet you soon,
Elfie

name: Your home for a stay of minimum 5 nights.
description:
Only room 'Sandra' is available for 2 persons by AirBnB.
[Su'ro] is a licensed guest room by Tourism Flanders

I offer a comfortable room with a box spring twin bed, a shower and sink. The private toilet is located on the lower floor. The well-equipped kitchen and living area and terrace are common.

The house is an ideal solution for business people who want to avoid the big hotels, students who are in Ghent for an internship, tourists who want to visit the art cities of Flanders from Ghent.
neighborhood_overview: [Su'ro] is located at 'Vlierstraat'. A calm neighbourhood nearby the University Hospital 'UZ Gent', the main train station 'Gent Sint-Pieters', all kind of   University departements of 'UGent' and about 2,5 km from the Belfry, old city centre.
host_about:
Als geboren Gentenaar ben ik fier op mijn levendige stad. Ik tracht de gasten zo veel mogelijk informatie te delen over cultuur, events en leven in Gent. Aangezien ik vaak thuis ben is er altijd mogelijkheid om informatie te vragen.
Ikzelf woon ook in de woning, de keuken, woonruimte en tuin zijn gemeenschappelijk. 
Mijn slogan is: Feel like a local, be like a local.

description:
garden studio with bathroom and kitchenette. Suitable for 2 adults and infants. City garden with furniture. Bedding and towels are provided.
A 10 min walk from historic city center.
Bicycles can be rented for a pin at less than 100 m. Via Donkey republic of dott
neighborhood_overview: Quiet heterogeneous working-class neighborhood located on the periphery of the historic city center, which is just a 10min walk away.  Parking in the yellow zone is free for the first 30 minutes. Paying between 9 and 19 hours at 0,80€ per hour. The green zone is 10 minutes steps away and completely free (Bromelia, Salviastraat etc). name: Modern, Luxurious, Quiet
description:
This house is super modern and still very cosy and charming. The house dates from 1907 and is totally renovated. The staircase is a silent whitness of the old days.
The garden is big and luxurious in a very quiet neighbourhood.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, green and still very close to all facilities. you can do everything by foot. Easy reachable with public transport and car. Private parking available on request.
host_about:
I am an Airline pilot. I live by myself and love to meet new people all over the world.
I am a sporty guy that likes to laugh. I play music and sing. 
I love Ghent, such a beatiful city. Even more then Bruges where I lived before.
I can tell you a lot about the city and show the nicest places to go to.
When I travel, I want to see and experiance as much as possible. I like to see how people really live and not take just the touristic paths.
If you come to my place you will experiance how the Belgian people really are and I am sure you will have an unforgettable time!

The loft is located on the edge of the city center, directly accessible via the Ring for cars, via the city park for pedestrians. Not really a special environment, but safe. The building contains acoustically insulated windows, so no street nuisance.
At 200m walking distance you can enjoy a classified park with play areas for children and picnic areas. Fitness center at ( 30m)
The main supermarkets and delicatessen less than 200 m.

name: Bright apt. with free parking and free bicycles
description: Welcome to this bright, airy and sunny apartment. It is located on the top floor of my 2-story apartment, which is part of a big old villa.There is one double bedroom, bathroom with shower and toilet and a living room with kitchen. Two bikes are included. Parking is free of charges !
neighborhood_overview:
This borough of Ghent is quiet and residential. Its location makes it a perfect spot to either visit the city or spend a day in the countryside.
There is a supermarket, bakery and butcher nearby. The Guislain museum is a stone's throw away. In summertime, there is the 'Parkcafé' where you can sit outside, enjoy the live music and have a bite to eat.
host_about:
Hi,
I'm Wim and I live in 'Ghent' - Belgium. Although Ghent is a surprisingly beautiful city, I love to travel around and meet the world. And if possible, I like to combine traveling with running, which is my only addiction (besides sweets and cake...:-)..). Short runs, marathons, trails, ... I love to run them all. 
And in between, I love to host you with the greatest pleasure in my apartment !

-> Spacious loft-style apartment

-> Located in the pedestrian area of the historical centre of Ghent: Cathedral and Churches - Historical Squares - Bell Tower

The residence is located in the pedestrianised heart of the old town.

As a permanent business traveller, I pick up ideas on décor and function from all over the world to recreate a stylish and warm home feeling wherever I am. 

Curiosity, social skills, integration, enjoyment, and respect are my key principles both as a guest and as a host.

Como viajero de negocios permanente, recojo ideas sobre decoración y funcionalidad de todo el mundo para recrear una sensación hogareña cálida y con estilo donde sea que esté.

name: Breathtaking Views in ❤ of Ghent with Hot Tub
description:
Renovated in January '18!
This apartment, built in 1864, is located in the very heart of Ghent: the Ajuinlei, the street with Parisian allure, close to all the most beautiful spots in Ghent. You can expect incredible views from the terrace over the Lys canal.
The place is 75m² and although in the very center of Ghent, it is amazingly quiet. Large Hot Tub/Jacuzzi for 2 in the bathroom.
Opera: 150m
Graslei: 310m
Kouter square: 180m
Koophandel Square: 65m
Restaurants: 1m
Aula & Het Pand: 200m
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is very unique because it is one of the very very few which has a large balcony with a stunning view on the canal. I looked around and I could only find 5 or 6 in the city center with a balcony where you could put a table. In the street you can find many good and affordable restaurants. I will send you a list of my preferred places.

Bert

description: We offer a spacious & modern fully furnished & equipped apartment, close to the center of Ghent, within 1 hour from Bruges, Antwerp and Brussels. The flat has a fully equipped kitchen, bathroom, WiFi, flatscreen TV, queen size boxspring and sofabed. Minimum stay is 1 month.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in Zwijnaarde (south of Ghent) opposite the UGent Technology Park. It’s less than 3 km from the Sint-Pieters train station and about 5 km from the city center. It’s in the immediate vicinity of both the E40 & E17 highway, the major traffic axes running through Belgium. From Ghent it’s also easy to explore other cities like Bruges, Brussels, Antwerp or the Belgian coast… They’re all within 50 km from Ghent.

Ghent is one of Europe’s best-kept secrets. It is small enough to still feel cosy yet dynamic enough to have that lively urban feel. The city offers a unique blend of medieval whimsy that reflects its long history in combination with a vibrant and contemporary edge. It has the great benefit that it’s off the beaten tourist trail with stunning architecture along its canals, great food, quirky cafés, and some of Belgium’s most interesting museums.

name: Luxurious suite in the historic centre of Ghent
description:
Our trendy accommodation is located in the centre of Ghent. The main market square is only 100 meters away.
There's a private bathroom with toilet, a bath, shower and sink. The apartment comes with a very large private green terrace, in the middle of the city.
We offer free Wifi and television.
Public parking "Vrijdagsmarkt" is nearby to park your car: 23€/24h.

There's an efficient check-in/-out process

We look forward to have you stay over with us!
neighborhood_overview: The accommodation can't be more central (!), located in a very calm alley between the waterside and one of the main shopping streets. Korenmarkt, Vrijdagsmarkt, Gravensteen all super close... The ideal hideout to explore thé most beautiful city of Belgium.
host_about:
Hi, we are Astrid and Gilles, 27 and 33. Born and raised in Moorslede and Bruges, we studied in Ghent and in Brussels. We fell in love and decided to settle in the beautiful city of Ghent. Whilst looking for a place to live, we bumped into what could be considered as one of the most centralised houses of Ghent. The house was old, dark and didn’t catch a lot of sunlight, but we saw a lot of possibilities to transform it into a little paradise in the ancient centre, close to all the hip and trendy places this city has to offer. As we travel a lot ourselves, we think we know what it takes to have a pleasant stay and discovering new cities and countries. We transformed the house in an ideal place for friends and guests visiting Ghent. By the summer of 2020 the house was finished.   
We hope you enjoy it as much as we do. 
Welcome in Ghent! 
Astrid & Gilles

name: Apartment with sunny terrace!
description:
Welcome to your urban oasis in Ghent!

Escape to our cozy apartment nestled just a stone's throw away from the vibrant city center. As you step outside onto the terrace, you're greeted by the amazing view of the water, creating a serene backdrop for your morning coffee.

Conveniently located, our apartment is a mere 10-minute bike ride or a leisurely 15-minute stroll from the bustling city center.

host_about:
Having called Ghent home for 15 years, I've fallen head over heels for this charming city. However, the time has come for me to embark on a new adventure and explore the streets of Brussels. That's why I'm thrilled to share my apartment with you in my absence. 

For almost 6 years, this apartment has been my home, filled with cherished memories. Now, it's your turn create your own unforgettable experiences.

name: Spacious room with private kitchen
description:
This spacious room in the attic is recently entirely renovated. Its luminous and well insulated. The room is part of a charming old city-house and has its own kitchen. The bathroom and toilet are shared.

I'm renting out this room to give guests a feeling of home in Ghent and to save some euros for further renovations of the house and the kids' future school fees.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is very close to the city center but still accessible by car. Also the trainstation is nearby and we have lots of green (a garden and e view of a park at the other side) which gives a bit of a nice city vibe without being suffocated by the city itself.
Around the corner there are plenty of parks and playgrounds for kids and a cinema.
It takes a little walk to be in the historic heart of the city.
host_about:
I'm a mother of one year old twins, renting out a room in our own family home. Ghent can be crowded, and so can be the hotels and hostels, therefore I see renting out a part of my private house as a great opportunity for both guest and host. But for obvious reasons we do not allow party people, extra guests, pets,... 
We respect guests and expect respect (silence and cleanliness) in return!

name: Spacious home with garden and free parking
description:
We would like to welcome you to our home, close to the city centre of the most beautiful city of Belgium or maybe even of the world. If you like culture, good food or just strolling around the streets, our house is the place to be.

Renting our house includes fresh towels, sheets, wifi, a comfortable bed, a warm bath or a cold shower. We have 2 cats that will welcome you. Our relaxing, big garden is shared with our neighbours.

Just one rule: take of your shoes and feel like you are at home.
neighborhood_overview:
Very safe, central but calm neighbourhood.

As the trainstation is just next door, you might hear it at night if you are not used to it.

Supermarkets, parks, train station, public transport and highways are closeby. Cars can be parked for free in front of the house.
Must see old City Centre Ghent @ 3 km. It is easy to get there by tram or by car. Or even by foot, if you feel like to walk.

name: Designer suite with large tub close to the station
description: Everything you need for a nice (re)treat
neighborhood_overview:
The stay sits in a quiet street just around the corner From the main station Gent-Sint Pieter's, with easy access to public transport.

In the direct proximity you can also find the museum district with main sites such as the STAM, the museum about the history of the city Ghent from early medieval times till now.
The MSK, the museum for old fine arts with all the masters such as Jordaens, Ruebens, Van Eyck and so much more. The GUM, the university museum located next to the botanical gardens with greenhouses which are free to visit.
Or the SMAK, which houses a very nice collection of modern and contemporary art with different exhibitions from time to time.

The old abbey Bijloke can be reached on a beautiful 10 -15 min walk, which brings you along the outskirts of the historic busy citycenter and all the real Ghent locations.

name: Stylish room in a warmhearted home + city garden
description:
If you pick our home, you don't book just a place to sleep but an entire experience with an experienced host in a lovely home!

My house is located in a lively, multicultural neighborhood a bit outside the citycenter. You share the house with me my 7 year old son Charlie.

What previous guests have said:
- Very comfortable bed
- House decorated with great taste
- Very welcoming host
- A bit far from center (but public transport at 2 min)
- Thin walls so a bit noisy
- Steep staircases
neighborhood_overview:
I live in a lively multicultural neighbourhood, which has its pros and cons. I love my neighbourhood because of the social mix and how this translates into the social and cultural scene. Streets can be lively, with kids and people hanging out on the streets, also in the evening (especially in summer). Downside is that this sometimes leads to some noise, but most of the time nothing exuberant.

Other reasons why I like my neighbourhood
- It is not anonymous. People actually know each other and say hello
- The communal garden at 50m from my house
- Café Congé: a hipster neighbourhood bar at 400m, in a small square with barely no cars and a lot of people on warm summer nights.
- Bakeries, butchers, nightshops, supermarkets & Pitta bars at 2-5 min walking distance
- For those who want to walk/run: we are 1 km away from "Bourgoyen"- a gorgeous & quiet nature reserve (google it!).
host_about:
I am a social justice activist who loves to bring people together. I love food, music, dancing, and of course my little boy Charlie.

With work, a child and activism, my life is pretty busy. My home is my haven where I meet up with friends, relax and recharge.

name: Private studio Creativo + free bikes
description: In a quiet green suburb just outside the medieval city centre, close to the nature reserve Bourgoyen-Ossemeersen. Busstop at 100 m. Gent is mijn geboortestad en daar ben ik fier op. Het is een stad met tal van mogelijkheden. Met mijn toerisme achtergrond help ik dan ook  graag een handje in het wegwijs maken van de talrijke to-do's. Mensen ontmoeten tijdens hun reistraject is steeds boeiend. 
Ghent is my hometown and I am really proud of it. It is a town with a variety of possibilities. With my tourism background I like helping people to find their way in the numerous to-do's. Meeting people during their trips I find very fascinating.

name: Flats with a soul, in the heart of Ghent.
description:
Ingrid and Luc have two luxury apartments for rent above their gallery. The apartments are situated in a fully restored nineteenth century house.
If you are a couple, a solo adventurer or someone who's travelling for work... our apartments are perfect!
neighborhood_overview:
The apartments are situated in Drabstraat 2 in the very heart of Ghent, above the Gallery of Kunstglasramen Mestdagh (Stained Glass Studio Mestdagh). From the front window you have a view on the Graslei and the Korenlei (the medieval port of Ghent) and on the boats which lie along the banks of the old harbour.
The Design museum is around the corner, just as the Gravensteen (the medieval Castle of the Counts), the Sint-Niklaaskerk (St Nicholas Church), the Belfry and many other places of interest.
In the neighbourhood there are many breakfast places restaurants, bars, but also bakers, butchers, department stores.

name: Apartment in the heart of the Historic Centre
description:
Beautiful, bright & quiet apartment in the heart of the Historic Centre at less than 200 yards from city highlights like the Belfry tower, the St. Bavo's Cathedral and the Gras- & Korenlei. Look outside the window and you will see the stunning St-Nicholas Church at your doorstep!

This is truly a wonderful location to stay at. Perfect to explore & enjoy the culture, history, energy & food :-) of this amazing city.

Welcome to "Belle Epoque" - you will feel right at home in lovely Ghent!
neighborhood_overview: This is a wonderful neighborhood to stay in.  You really can't imagine a better & more central location.  Everything is within walking distance: beautiful historical buildings, the cultural highlights, great restaurants, cosy bars & local shops - it's really Ghent at its best.  From the moment you come outside you will feel the energy and history of this beautiful city.  And at the apartment you will find a little city guide that I made for my guests to show you all the best that Ghent has to offer :-)
host_about:
Hi,

I'm Veerle from Ghent.  During college I spent a year in Costa Rica as part of a student exchange program.   I stayed in the house of a lovely family.  They were wonderfully hospitable and after a while I even called them my mammi, pappi & hermanas :-).  I really felt at home there.  I quickly realized how amazing it is to be able to have a home away from home.  Since then, when I travel I always look for a place to stay that gives me that same feeling.  And when my friends, family or you :-)  come to visit beautiful Ghent I try to offer that same kind of hospitality.

I hope to see you soon!

name: Traveller's house:cosy private bed+living+bathroom
description:
I invite you to stay in a cosy & quiet top floor in a traveller's house. I offer a private bed, bath & living room. You can feel & taste the world in my house. Travelling is my life, my oxygen, my passion & my addiction.
The neighborhood is quiet & close to the center (3,5 km). A beautiful nature reserve & some shops are at walking distance. Important: free parking!
My house is perfect for couples, solo or business travelers.
For the moment I only rent my house for long term stays.
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a quiet neighborhood of Gent. Next to our house, at a walking distance of 5 minutes, there's a nature reserve, 'De Bourgoyen'.
Close to us (10 minutes walking), you can find some big shops (Colruyt, Aldi, Lidl, Carrefour,...) & a street with lots of small shops.
At the end of our street (2 min. walk) you can find a swimming pool.
There are 2 very nice pubs/restaurants at walking distance from our house (De Ganzerik & Café Congé).
host_about:
My name is Elke and I am 41. I live in a beautiful city, Gent.
I love to travel the world and meet local people. 
I don't smoke & I prefer a calm & relax place to stay.
I like to read,  watch series, talk about life, photography, fashion, ...

Full kitchen with 4 cooking plates, dishwasher, fridge, all utensils, …

name: Paparazzo - Ghent (city center)
description:
Paparazzo is a one bedroom apartment in the very city centre of Ghent. It's entirely decorated by owner & photographer Filip Naudts whose work is on show on the web.
You can buy his prints that are exposed in the apartment!

CORONA SAFE:
No contact with the host needed.
You can enter the apartment with your personal code.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in the city centre.
host_about:
Born in Ghent, I grew up very nearby, in Lochristi, where I founded my photostudio and where I still live today. Currently I'm a photographing artist, working additionally for Belgian press. In my work I focus on portraiture as I need the interaction with people. That's also why I decided to start-up two tourist apartments which are both popular amongst art and photography lovers.

For more info on my work enter 'filip naudts' in your browser

name: Renovated triplex in the city centre of Ghent
description:
Renovated triplex in the city centre of Ghent, 10 minutes walking from the historic city. In a very quiet neighborhood.
On the first floor is a kitchen.
On the second floor is the living area. The sofa turns into a bed for 1 person.
On the third floor you will find a double bed for 2 persons.
2 separate toilets and a shower.

name: Private studio near city center
description: The studio has a double bed, sleeper sofa, TV with Netflix, private bathroom and kitchen. There is a separate entrance and access to the shared garden (BBQ available). Easy to reach by car (parking in the street: €3,50/day, free on Sunday and holidays), public transportation or taxi. Located in a quiet area, just outside the city center (10 min by bus or bike,  2 bikes available). Walking distance of beautiful nature reserve the Bourgoyen. Close to supermarkets, bars, restaurant, bakery,...
neighborhood_overview:
The studio is located in a quiet residential area in Brugse Poort / Rooigem, just outside the city center.
A five minute walk takes you to the unique open landscape of the Bourgoyen, which is perfect for birdwatching, walking or a run.

If you come by car, the central location has a good connection to all major highways and there is free parking in front of the studio.
If you come by train, you can reach the studio by bus and a short walk. There is a fast connection by bus to the city center and we have bikes available.

description: The accomadation itself is a spaceous, airy rooftop room with high ceilings in a renovated mansion house from the end of the 19th century.
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is located in an interesting neighborhood between the' new docks' with this amazing new architecture and the historical old city center,
10 min walking distance from the railway station Dampoort, the center, Portus Ganda, Baudelopark and a lot of fine dining possibilities.
Also a great coffee bar around the corner for breakfast amd brunch with a sunny terrace.

name: Charming & Spacious 3 bedroom home near Gent
description:
Welcome to this charming home (suitable for 7 guests), a 11 minute tram ride away from the historic centre of Ghent.

The cosy living room, bathroom and fully equipped kitchen let you unwind after a day of exploring. (Don't feel like cooking? You're within Deliveroo range, no worries!)

The tram takes you straight to:
- St. Bavo's Cathedral
- Korenmarkt
- Gravensteen Castle

Exploring Belgium by car? You can easily park nearby and reach:
- Brussels
- Antwerp
- Bruges
- Ypres
neighborhood_overview: Ledeberg is a lively and diverse neighbourhood, just a 10 minute tram ride away from the historical center of Ghent. Within walking distance you will find various supermarkets, a fitness, frituur, pharmacy and parks. Public transportation is easily accessible and quickly takes you to the center and other parts of Ghent.
host_about: Hi! I'm Eveline and I am happy to welcome you in my home. I love food and traveling, so I'm happy to provide information about Gent and my favourite food hot spots if you're curious!

name: Modern family house in old beguinage in the center
description:
You stay in a quiet and peaceful beguinage area, very easily accessible by public transport/car. In a 5min walk you are in the city center: first you discover the Gravensteen castle and you take the rest, depending on your interests.

HOUSE
Inside you'll find it is tastefully minimal and modernly renovated. It is the perfect place to stay in Ghent for families with kids older than 3 years. From here you can also visit easily Antwerp, Brussels, Bruges etc.

name: Bed Resort - Belfort
description:
Bed Resort - Belfort is a designer apartment, located in the heart of the historic Ghent center, overlooking the St. James church at the end of the Belfort street.

Within walking distance of Ghent-Dampoort station, close to all tourist attractions, bike rental and very good public transportation connection.

Hungry or thirsty? Nearby you will find plenty of hospitality business and supermarkets.

The apartment has all the modern comforts: Wi-Fi, cable TV, fully equipped kitchen.
neighborhood_overview:
There is certainly no shortage of markets and other entertainment here in the lively city center. From Friday to Sunday morning there is weekly Prondelmarkt (second and brocante) at the Sint-Jacobskerk, on Sunday Flower Market on the Kouter, delicious food shopping at the Friday market ...

Restaurants and snack bars near the stain, shops and boutiques nearby! If you are looking for a nice city walk, we would like to refer you to visit gent. A selection of our favorite wining and dining spots, city map and other tourist information can be found in the info folder on the apartment.

The studio is located in the oldest part of Ghent, 700m from the Friday market, the oldest market in the city. The Patershol with its numerous restaurants is also accessible within the same distance.

The studio is located in the oldest section of Ghent, on 700m from the Vrijdagsmarkt, the oldest market in the city. The Patershol, which houses countless restaurants, is within the same distance.
There are bus stations for public transport everywhere and the station of Gent-Dampoort is just a 13-minute walk.

Shops, restaurants  and nightlife are readily available. The apartment is part of a nice, luxurious building with no night noise or disturbances of any kind.
host_about: I am Charlotte, a 30-year old, happy girl, living in Ghent and enjoying living and working in Ghent to the fullest. I am living together with my boyfriend in my own apartment in the city-center. I have travelled a lot with Airbnb before and I've only had amazing experiences so far. That's why I decided to start hosting myself. I am most happy to share my lovely apartment (yes I really adore it :)), with others as I think it is the perfect place to stay when in Ghent. Looking forward to hosting you!

This 17th century townhouse is the perfect holiday house for your family, friends or colleagues. It's located in one of the most picturesque neighbourhoods in the heart of Ghent. (5min walk from the city centre!)

Instagram: @friday.gent
neighborhood_overview: Our guesthouse is situated in 'Het Prinsenhof', a medieval gem in the historic city centre of Ghent.  ‘Het Prinsenhof’ or Prince’s Court was a grand castle, birthplace of Emperor Charles V (16th century). The neighbourhood is super charming and above all quiet and calm. We are 5 minutes away from the famous 'Gravensteen' castle and 'De Graslei'. There are plenty of nice coffee bars, restaurants and supermarkets within walking distance.
host_about:
Hi, 

I'm Marie and I grew up in the historical centre of Ghent. 
Now I live with my little family just outside of the city. 

I still love wandering through this hidden gem. 
I'm sure you'll love it too!

You'll find plenty of places to eat and to do in my Guidebook. 

Welcome! 

Marie

description:
Our cozy loft is very suitable for 1 quiet couple or families with 1 or 2 children.
The loft is right in the center of Ghent, in a car-free street next to the Kouter. Under the Kouter is a large covered public parking that is open 24/24.

The loft is on the third floor, and there is no elevator.

name: Cute house with little private garden & 2 bicycles
description:
Charming beluikhuisje from 1840 in Ghent – ​​Modernized and comfortable for 4 people
Welcome to our typical Ghent beluikhuisje, completely modernized & equipped with all comforts. The cozy kitchen is fully equipped. There are 2 bedrooms with a double bed. Enjoy the charming city garden. Within 10 minutes by bike you can reach the historic center or the beach of Blaarmeersen. Two bicycles are available. Book now and experience the best of Ghent from our cozy house!
neighborhood_overview:
Discover Ghent from this central oasis

Welcome to our charming home, ideally located for your exploration of Ghent!

Only 15 minutes walking distance from the historical center, so you can easily walk to the city.

For groceries, you have all the comforts within easy reach with various supermarkets nearby, the nearest of which is only 350 meters away.

Gent is known as a bike-friendly city, and for your convenience we provide two student bikes.
Enjoy a relaxing bike ride to the bustling shopping streets just 15 minutes away.
Want to find nature?
The Blaarmeersen, only 2 km away and the Watersportbaan are within walking or cycling distance for a refreshing walk.
host_about:

name: Classy penthouse with terrace in the heart of Gent
description:
A guesthouse in style for people with style.
Our high-end duplexapartment is very accessibly located in between the 'Kouter' (rectangle square where the Flemish Opera is) and the medieval center (St-Bavo-Cathedral, Graslei, Korenmarkt, Gravensteen to name a few highlights).
Brand new, comfortable and classy, with a library-staircase which is not only an eyecatcher. 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms. Sunny terrace!
We called our gem "LaCasitaBelMundo”, just adding the dot Gent, to get the full picture.
neighborhood_overview: You can't hardly be located more central, nearto Kouter and Korenmarkt with a lot of hip bars, nice restaurants, fancy shops, quality supermarkets (Delhaize, Cru, Albert Heijn, BioMarket) and on only a few minutes walk from the historical center (Graslei, Gravensteen, St.-Bavo-Cathedral).  You will notice, time is too short.  Explore and taste Ghent, a worthwile visit.
host_about:
We like to travel ourselve, within Europe mostly last years.  But in our earlier life we used to backpack in South- and Central-America, Asia,..   something we hope to do that soon again, though we'll probably prefer a bit more comfort at our age ;-)
Our common interest is broad with an open mind on what is happening in our turbulent world.  We try to give that through to our 9-year-old son.  But let us keep to the love we share for culture, art, music, cinema, theater, ....
Although we like nature a lot, a vibrant city gives us such a wide variety of impressions.  We are new on airbnb, but we booked recently Lisbon and Barcelona.

name: Cozy apartment in the historic center
description: Quiet apartment in the historic city center of Ghent, in a residential area near the Recolettenlei. The largest shopping street in Ghent and the Graslei with its many terraces are within walking distance. Public transport and car parks are at about 500 meters.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is very centrally located in a particularly quiet neighborhood with hardly any traffic. The Veldstraat, the busiest shopping street in Ghent, is a five-minute walk away. The bustling Graslei, cultural center Vooruit, the Medieval towers, museums and countless bars and restaurants are also nearby, as are public transport and various parking garages.

Ghent is also ideally located for visiting the other Flemish art cities, such as Bruges (30 minutes by car), Antwerp (50 minutes) and Brussels (40 minutes). The surrounding countryside, with the artists' village of Deurle and the Flemish Ardennes, is also worthwhile.

Living The Moment is a completely renovated home in the heart of Ghent. The house is located on a very quiet street, near the restored river borders. description:
Welcome to our charming B&B, ideally located in the historic center of Ghent, just steps from Gravensteen Castle! Discover comfort, style, and warm hospitality and:
- Prime location: Walk to cultural landmarks, amazing restaurants, and charming shops
- Modern comforts: Spacious rooms, private bathrooms, free wifi
- Outdoor charm: Relax on the sunny terrace or enjoy peaceful surroundings
- Convenient access: Close to public transport and paid parking available
Book your unforgettable stay today!
neighborhood_overview:
This part of historic Ghent is the most quiet, because of the closter atmosphere. You will enjoy walking through the small streets to all the cultural points of interest , the restaurants and the bars which are all at walking distance.

Located in one of the most serene parts of historic Ghent, our neighborhood is celebrated for its tranquil cloister-like atmosphere. Strolling through the charming narrow streets, you’ll find yourself immersed in history and culture, with a wealth of restaurants, bars, and cultural landmarks within walking distance. This area offers a perfect balance of peace and proximity, making it ideal for those who want to relax and explore the vibrant heart of Ghent.

Neighbourhood Highlights:
- Gravensteen Castle – 1.2 km (15-minute walk)
- Korenmarkt – 1 km (12-minute walk)
- Saint Bavo's Cathedral – 1 km (12-minute walk)
- Patershol District – 1.5 km (18-minute walk)
- Museum of Fine Arts – 3 km (10-minute tram ride)

description:
Discover the charm of "French Green," a light-filled room in the heart of Ghent. Nestled in B&B Petit Prince, this retreat blends style, sustainability, and comfort, 5 minutes from the historic center, as well as:
- 1.60m bed with luxurious linens,
- Private bathroom with eco shower,
- Direct garden access & cozy sitting area,
- Delicious breakfast (€17 pp) with homemade delights,
- Fast WiFi, room-darkening shades, family-friendly extras,

The BnB is located near the city center. It is about 8 min walking to the central square Korenmarkt and the medieval Gravensteen fortress. Restaurants and bars are also within walking distance. Although located close to the center, the BnB is situated in a quite neighborhood and you will enjoy a peaceful sleep. Churches, cathedrals, the Belfry, the Town Hall, a boat trip on the Leie Canals, musea.... Discover the beautiful city of Ghent by walking through the small streets in a relaxing atmosphere.

Neighbourhood Highlights:
- Gravensteen Castle – 700 m (8-minute walk)
- Korenmarkt – 700 m (8-minute walk)

name: Bij het station van Drongen
description: The house is in a quiet neighborhood. Train station and bus stop nearby with good connection to Ghent center and Bruges. Lots of hiking and biking possibilities.
neighborhood_overview: The cities of Ghent and Bruges are easily accessible. You can hike and bike along the river Leie with foot springs in Afsnee and Drongen-Baarle. You can hike at the Assels and at the nearby Bourgoyen Nature Reserve. The artists' village of Sint-Martens-Latem is also close by. The university complex "De Sterre" is easily accessible by bicycle and train. Bicycles can be stored safely and dryly in the garage.

name: Gezellig rijhuisje in Gent
description:
The house is situated in a quiet neighborhood close to Gent Dampoort Station. The historical centre can easily be reached on foot or by bus. The house is supplied with all conveniences.
Wifi is available.

Check in at 3pm
Check out at 12am

W-E-L-C-O-M-E
host_about:
Hi Folks,

I’d like to invite you in my fully restored, bright and open house.  It still needs further work, such as painting... The house is located in walking distance from the city center. The Kunstenaarstraat is a nice and quiet street with a park just around the corner. Shops, places to eat, supermarkets and a few bars are also nearby. 

The accomodation contains a fully fitted kitchen with a gas stove, a fridge and a freezer. We have a dishwasher too! Please feel free to use our espresso machine.

Upstairs you’ll find a bathroom  with a toilet, lavabo and a rainshower. Next to it there is the first bedroom which contains a single mattress and a toddlers bed. Above all this there is a mezzanine with a double bed.

You’ll have access to WiFi.

Bed linen and towels are provided.

description:
- garden Jacuzzi & IR Sauna
- 10 min from City Center
- ultimate privacy
- free quality bikes

We love vintage furniture, plants, and old music. That's exactly what you will find in this room with a tropical garden view and direct access. Discover our 60's record player, browse through our three-generation record collection, and lead yourself back into the good old days. The historic city is within a stone's throw.
neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet suburb area next to the historical center. Perfect for a relaxed stay in Ghent. This neighborhood has a surprising side! For example, in your short way to the city center, there is one of the most impressive and secret historical urban exploring sites! We tell you all about them in our extensive guide, full of tips and off the beaten track sights! Oh, and the best fries shop in Ghent is only 2 min walking from your room! We love our city and want you to see the best parts of it! Thanks to the bikes and phone holders, the whole city is within reach!
host_about: Wij zijn Esteban en Jeroen, een avontuurlijk koppel dat een passie deelt voor reizen en unieke ervaringen bieden aan onze medemens. name: La bellétage by agelandkaai(.be) Free Parking
description:
Hello, and welcome to La bellétage by Agelandkaai(.be)
Here and online you will find all the info you need to contact us. May be of interest to you to contact us online first.
Search once on the web.
Occupancy taxes and fees is sadly a new tax of 6% imposed by our government, the rest is the Tourist Tax off 4€ a night, for each guest.
neighborhood_overview:
Dampuurt, little old Town House on Hagelandkaai, just across the old lock.
Near Kiosko, a summer bar in the little lock house.
City Hall at 900 m, not 25km…
Nightshop just behind us in Dampoortstraat, literally our back neighbours, we call it The Big Fridge.
One block further along the big road is an artisanal Bakery.
Turkish, African, Bulgarian, … shops in Dampoortstraat, and a good SPAR supermarket on Joremaaie, passing in coming home, like 300m from the house.
Dok Brewery is in walking distance, with 30 beers on tap, pizza, burgers, barbecue.
Really nice place with good food and beer. It's on an newly renovated old Factory site, worth a walk around. That area along the other site of the water leaving the city, is now being newly re-developed.
host_about:
Hello, we are Jurgen & Tom
History teacher/certified guide and train manager.
Happy to have you stay with us in our house, we hope it makes you, as many others, feel at home.

When looking for dates to book, might be a good idea to look up agelandkaai online, (our landcode is be), and have a look there, you'll find special offers on restaurants, the parking policy and other extra's, like our walking tours through Gent, and what we offer on food and drinks.

You might notice that we are not available on saturdays for checking in or out. That way we keep our saturdays somewhat to ourselves (cleaning wise). Or to have time for our experience, a historic walking tour through Gent, with Jurgen as your guide.

However if you're staying for four or more days, you can always inquire to arrive or leave on a saturday. Mostly won't be a problem. You have a no, but you might get a yes…

name: Romantic 17th century workers house + free parking
description: This fully renovated cottage is located in the city center of Ghent. Within walking distance of all the sights but still very quiet. The whole house is available for you. The cottage has a city garden, kitchen, bathroom, bedroom, living room, separate toilet and entrance.
neighborhood_overview: Within walking distance you will find impressive historic buildings and places, museums, shopping streets and numerous cool cafés and restaurants. No matter where you look, in the largely car-free city center you will always see a building or a monument with a story. Mosquito Coast is by far the best restaurant in town to enjoy fusion food. MOSQUITO COAST is a restaurant with a 'travel theme' in Ghent, since 1999. “An offbeat cafe with an adventurous character”, as they call themselves. About 2 minutes’ walk from our place.

Otomat

Otomat has invented pizzas made from the best beer in the world: Belgian Duvel Beer. All the pizzas are also served with exclusive Belgian Beers. Three minutes and you are there!

name: Stylish Studio 'Suite César' in the heart of Ghent
description:
If you are looking for a short time stay in Ghent, 'SUITE CESAR' is the ideal place for you!

Situated in the Tinnenpotstraat, 400m from the Gravensteen Castle, our bright studio will be your cosy cocoon in the heart of the city.

We provide you a fully furnished, modern and affordable studio with room up to 2 people.
Our kitchen includes a microwave, Nespresso machine, water boiler, induction cooking plate and big fridge.

Free WIFI!
neighborhood_overview:
Suite César is located in a prime location in the historical center of Ghent.
Situated in the Tinnenpotstraat, a charming and quiet neighborhood, a few minutes walk from the bustling center.

The Tinnenpotstraat owes its name to the hostel 'In den Tinnen Pot' (house number 44-46).
It already existed in the 14th/15th century and still can be recognized by the sign above the door.
This street is also famous for the Tinnenpot Theater on number 21.

Nearby is the Prinsenhof, created by buildings around the former Hof ten Walle, the residence of the Viscount of Ghent.
This Hof ten Walle was the birthplace of Emperor Charles V and was named from then on 'Prinsenhof'.

400m away the Gravensteen Castle is located, the only surviving medieval castle in Flanders and a very important tourist attraction for the city.
host_about:
MOM - MARRIED - BORN IN THE 80'S

LOVE: Nature - Traveling - Family - Interior Design - Fashion - Netflix

Enjoy The Little Things In Life!

Vibrant neighborhood
Various shops in walking distance. Colruyt, Aldi, Carrefour, bio planet. Moroccan grocers and Turkish bakers are a 10-minute walk away, as well as eatery Woest, cafe congé, and tea house trafiek.
The beautiful historic center of gent easily accessible by public transportation or on foot.
Park "the green valley" is less than 5 minutes walk away.
Swimming lake "de blaarmeersen" within a 10-minute bike ride away

Antwerp, Brussels and Ostend by the sea, 15 minutes by car

name: Villa Leona deluxe with amazing rooftop terrace
description:
Villa Leona
A brand new, fully furnished, well situated, cosy and trendy loft for at least 5 people with amazing and very spacious rooftop terrace.

It is perfect for family, friends, couples and business travellers who want to visit Ghent and Sint-Martens-Latem, known for its rich art tradition. There are excellent restaurants nearby.

This luxurious, first level apartment (part of HUIS19) is adaptable to your needs. So it’s also for rent for meetings, presentations, workshops, etc…
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is very close to the river Leie where you can take the manually operated ferry to cross it. From that point you can walk endlessly into the nature.
You have lots of very nice biking routes in all kind of categories.
We can arrange a boat or kayaks (both optional) to get to Ghent using the river Leie (in summer only).

The apartment is situated just outside Ghent and just next to the world famous Sint-Martens-Latem, known for its rich art tradition that characterises the East Flanders Lys Valley. There are excellent restaurants nearby.

name: Terraced Beauty in Ghent Center
description: Welcome to our Vibrant 2-Bedroom Apartment in the Heart of Ghent! Our apartment offers a perfect blend of modern comfort and unbeatable convenience. With two cozy bedrooms and 1.5 bathrooms, it's an ideal retreat for families or friends exploring this beautiful city. The apartment’s prime location allows you to effortlessly stroll to Ghent's main attractions, restaurants and shoppings, immersing yourself in the city's rich history and vigorous culture.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!
*History & Culture*
Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting Google’s top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

This is the most convenient location of the city specially for first timers in Ghent. It is super close to Sint Pieters Station, so you don't have to book or ride anything to get started in the city. Dear, I'm so glad to hear that you want to stay in Ghent.

The house is not in the center of Ghent, but it is easy and easy to reach by tram 2.
There are buses to different places in and around Ghent. On foot it takes 30 to 45 minutes to get to the center.

One block further along the big road is an artisanal Bakery.
Turkish, African, Bulgarian, … shops in Dampoortstraat, and a good SPAR supermarket on Joremaaie, passing in coming home, like 300m from the house.
Dok Brewery is in walking distance, with 30 beers on tap, pizza, burgers, barbecue.
Really nice place with good food and beer. It's on an newly renovated old Factory site, worth a walk around. That area along the other site of the water leaving the city, is now being newly re-developed.
host_about:
Hello, we are Jurgen & Tom
History teacher/certified guide and train manager.
Happy to have you stay with us in our house, we hope it makes you, as many others, feel at home.

When looking for dates to book, might be a good idea to look up agelandkaai online, (our landcode is be), and have a look there, you'll find special offers on restaurants, the parking policy and other extra's, like our walking tours through Gent, and what we offer on food and drinks.

You might notice that we are not available on saturdays for checking in or out. That way we keep our saturdays somewhat to ourselves (cleaning wise). Or to have time for our experience, a historic walking tour through Gent, with Jurgen as your guide.

However if you're staying for four or more days, you can always inquire to arrive or leave on a saturday. Mostly won't be a problem. You have a no, but you might get a yes…

name: Minimalistic House Near Ghent
description:
Welcome to our cottage in the suburbs of Ghent!

We are expats who divide their time between two beautiful cities: Uppsala (Sweden) and Ghent.

When we are away, we have decided to share our home with other travelers, who can enjoy a restful stay in the quiet suburbs and combine this with a visit to the beautiful city of Ghent.
neighborhood_overview: Within walking distance from our house, you can find a supermarket (Carrefour), a bakery and a butcher. If you like to be outdoors, we can recommend the nature park “Bourgoyen-Ossemeersen”, which is only 1,5 km away and is nice green spot to relax. If you are by bike, it only takes about 15 minutes to go to the city center, there are lots of cycling routes to choose from. Or you can go to the nearest bus stop (100m) or the tram stop (1,2 km)

name: Maison Etienne, luxurious short stay near Ghent
description:
Maison Etienne
A brand new, fully furnished, well situated, cosy and trendy loft for at least 5 people with a garden.

It is perfect for family, friends, couples and business travellers who want to visit Ghent and Sint-Martens-Latem, known for its rich art tradition. There are excellent restaurants nearby.

This luxurious, ground level apartment (part of HUIS19) is adaptable to your needs.
Therefore it’s also for rent for meetings, product presentations, workshops, etc
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is very close to the river Leie where you can take the manually operated ferry to cross it. From that point you can walk endlessly into the nature.
You have lots of very nice biking routes in all kind of categories.
We can arrange a boat or kayaks (both optional) to get to Ghent using the river Leie (in summer only).

The apartment is situated just outside Ghent and just next to the world famous Sint-Martens-Latem, known for its rich art tradition that characterises the East Flanders Lys Valley. There are excellent restaurants within short distance.

name: Modern apartment close to Flanders Expo
description:
Modern and stylish apartment on the outskirts of the lovely city Gent.

In walking distance to the ‘Flandes Expo’ event center and close to the train station Gent Sint-Pieters (+/- 1.5 km). It will take you about 10-15 min to reach the city center by bike or car.

Free underground secured parking.

You have immediate access to the highways E40 (Brussels - Belgian coastline) and E17 (Antwerp/Netherlands - France).

There is a tram stop at the Flanders Expo that goes straight to the city center.
neighborhood_overview: The recreational (sport)park ‘de Blaarmeersen’ is just around the corner. More information on activities and getting around upon request!
host_about:
Hi!

My apartment is located in the outskirts of the lovely city Gent, close to the train station and the 'Flanders Expo' event center. Also, the recreational (sport)park ‘de Blaarmeersen’ is just around the corner. By bike or car it takes 10-15 min to the city center (yes, it's the same!). 
If you travel by car, you have immediate access to the highways E40 (Brussels - Belgian coastline) and E17 (Antwerp/Netherlands - France).

name: Big and beautiful house at Citadelpark
description: Our spacious 4 floor house, built in 1880, is located conveniently close to the central train station (Gent-Sint-Pieters) and alongside Ghent's Citadel park.  The art museums are a very short stroll through the park and the city centre is easily reachable by tram (3 stops) or walking (20 minutes) from our very peaceful neighbourhood.
neighborhood_overview: The citadel park, which is right at the house, provides a great place to start your mornings with a run or walk.  The art galeries and an exhibition centre are located in the park.  Our street is one-way, and very calm thanks to the 30km/h speed limit.
host_about: Angela and Boudewijn are retired and enjoy traveling immensely.  When traveling ourselves, we very much like to stay in a real home, rather than a hotel.  We enjoy the privacy of being in a home, especially when we travel with friends & family.  We warmly welcome you to our home in Gent!

name: Loft boat 'The Panter' in the ancient harbour
description:
'The Panter' is a 39meter boat from the sixties. Used for years in transport, it is now tastefully transformed into a loftboat. The front part of the boat is entirely yours and has a private entrance. The three of us live in the tail end of the boat with our cat.
The studio consists of a living room & kitchen with a mezzanine that has a double bed. The second part is a smaller room with double bed, shower and toilet. Outside you can enjoy the sunset from the upper deck or relax in the patio.
neighborhood_overview: In front of the boat is a large park with play-areas for children. Nearby are open-air swimming opportunities. There are a few little grocery stores and cosy cafés in the area.

name: studio met dubbel bed, kitchenette, privé badkamer
description:
Studio within walking distance of the center (20'), the stop of the Flixbus and a station (12'), a bus stop (3'), butcher, neighborhood shop, supermarket, hip brown cafe and cheap trendy lunch restaurant In a quiet wide street with little traffic and lots of trees. Safe neighborhood.
The studio is located on the upper floor (2nd) & is completely private. You can put your bikes in the hallway & park for barely 3.5 euros/day.
neighborhood_overview:
Ideal in terms of accessibility by car (exit Gent-Antwerp E17). Parking in the street for barely 3.5 euros/day. Perfect if by train or Flixbus (both station Gent Dampoort & then 12'follow the cycling and walking path). You can also rent bicycles here at this station!
By foot 20' from the city center. On one hand, "Zuid", where "the Krook" dominates, the new library near the university and the latest example of modern architecture. In this neighborhood you can enjoy breakfast, brunch and shopping. Also just 20' walking distance, in the other direction, 'Portus Ganda', a marina with the 'Ghent Lorelei' just next to the Sint-Baafsabdij, one of the most poetic historical sites of Ghent. There is also no lack of cozy terraces, affordable restaurants and hip cafes.
At 20' from a swimming pool complex in a park with walking track and fifteen minutes from a 240 hectares nature reserve along the Scheldt with a cycling and walking path. Ideal for joggers or getting it after that night
