name: Cozy house in green setting close to Ghent
description:
Lovely house with shared entrance and kitchen in a calm neighborhood in Drongen nearby the beautiful city of Ghent (less then 15 minutes by car).
Other cities like Bruges, Brussels and Antwerp are only 60min or less away.
Golf court nearby.
neighborhood_overview:
As little as a 15 minute drive you have the beautiful city of Ghent.
It’s old historic centre lights up beautifully by night so please go and have a look.

At proximity of the house you can go have a walk or bike (if you would bring them) into the country site.

There’s also a golf court nearby (1.2km/0.8 miles). ‘Golfschool Gent’

There are tons of supermarkets close by aswell as bakeries and butchers. (In the city center of Drongen)
There is a convenience store at walking distance (1.3km/0.8 miles) where you’ll find everything you need (it’s also open on sunday).
More information about the bakeries, butchers and supermarkets can be found at the house.

name: Master Bedroom in Ghent (8 min. from center)
description:
Welcome to our house near the waterside in Ghent. We are situated in a quiet area with easy access to the city center and the train stations (tram stop is 1 minute away).

We offer towels, soap, and laundry service. In our kitchen you'll find coffee, tea, cooking herbs, olive oil, pots and pans, utensils. All are free to use.

This is a family-owned house with 2 Airbnb rooms.
neighborhood_overview:
This entire city area has been renovated by the city government to include a new shopping center, housing projects, public schools, cultural venues, etc. Our street has just been renovated. The wobbly and narrow pavement has been replaced by a broad and flat one, and we all have a small facade garden now. Also the tramway and the parking spaces are brand-new.

Within 500 m of our house:
• Belfius Bank ATM
• Q8 Gas station
• Tram & Bus stops
• Dok Noord Shopping Center:
- Supermarket
- Pharmacy
- Fitness
- Coffee
- Sports Bar

name: M/S Carpe-Diem "Cargo Hold" - Loft on a Barge
description:
M/S Carpe-Diem, "Seize-the-Day", is a barge built in 1951. The ship is moored in the old docklands of Ghent and has been transformed into an exceptional, eco-friendly home.
The ship's cargo hold has been renovated into a contemporary, loft-like residence of 65 square meter, with all modern comfort, including an outdoor pool with jet stream.
The cargo hold accommodates maximum 4 people, with two separate bedrooms with double beds.  Ideal for tourists and expatriate professionals.
host_about:
Hello, I am Filip, father of two beautiful daughters and husband to an exceptional wife.

A few years ago, we bought an old ship in a flash of absolute lack of sense of reality. In the meantime, we have renovated the ship and transformed it into a modern home. Feel free to view the photos; the ship is the ideal base camp for exploring the city of Ghent and Flanders.

Travel safely ... and maybe see you soon in Ghent.

Filip & Co.

name: Modern Spacious Apartment in Ghent's Vibrant Heart
description: Step into your perfect retreat in the heart of Ghent, where families, friends, and explorers find their haven. Our spacious apartment, accommodating up to 6 guests across 2 bedrooms, invites you to revel in the city's medieval charm while indulging in modern comfort. Immerse yourself in the rich history of Ghent, as national landmarks, museums, and stunning gothic architecture unfold just steps away.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!
*History & Culture*
Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting Google’s top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

name: Shelter7
description:
An entire townhouse for you alone? Shelter7 is a modern architectural gem, right in the centre of Ghent. A mixture of brutalism, minimalism, and Wabi Sabi.
The facade consists of a concrete structure, which forms the chalk line of an old print. The loft brings in light from the outside. A surprising combination of 3 floors intended to bring each guest to relax and unwind. Oikofilie at its best.
Shelter7 is a B&E, a bed & experience, it offers extra tailored experiences.
neighborhood_overview: Right in the middle of the historic city center, 50 meters from the Belfry, 100 meters from the city house and city hall, 250 meters from the Graslei and less than 500 meters from the Gravensteen. But still in a cosy, quieter street.
host_about:
A fan of the Wabi-Sabi art that I try to express into my lifestyle and the interior of Shelter 7 and Verne Dreams. 
I’m a content and positive person, always curious to meet new people and connect with new synergies.

name: Studio Black Cat — Ghent downtown
description: Cosy studio hidden behind Ghent's greenest facade. Fully furnished for a short break or long stay in the heart of Medieval Flanders.
neighborhood_overview:
Our studio is located in the city centre. As the city of Ghent is not a gigantic metropolis, all must sees are within walking distance. Public transport is just around the corner, and the connection to both of Ghent's train stations is excellent.
How about a morning stroll along the gorgeous 'Visserij', taking you straight into Portus Ganda? Or wander through the cobblestone squares and alleys along the towers of the city's historic heart?
Around the corner you'll find an artisanal bakery and a small supermarket providing you with everything to kickstart your day.
We have a few excellent restaurants - a bit off the beaten track - within 5 minutes walking distance: Elvire (€) serves the best burgers in town, Viva la Puglia (€€) does Italy at its best & De Fobie (€€) serves a traditional Belgian cuisine. Bar Bask (€€€) is an eclectic Basque style restaurant with pintxos to die for!

name: Your Luxury Home Away from Home 2
description: Your luxury home away from home! This house from the 60s is 5 minutes walk from Ghent St.Pieters station.  It is located on a beautiful avenue where you leave the hustle and bustle of the city center behind you.  It was beautifully renovated with exclusive materials and furnished with attention to detail.  A cozy living room with open gas fireplace, open kitchen and 4 bedrooms with 4 bathrooms.  We are happy to welcome 6 people.  The ideal base for visiting Ghent with friends or family.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is at a very short distance from St-Pieters Station. But still in a quiet and cul-de-sac . With tram 1, you can reach the full city center in 10 minutes.
Some top attractions in the city center of Ghent are the "Graslei" , the Sint Baafskathedral with the Lam Gods, the Gravensteen, a boat trip on De Leie, The House of Alijn, the Patershol, the Vrijdagsmarkt with cozy cafes and restaurants.

name: Urban Loft | A unique spot to start your discovery
description:
Welcome at Urban Loft. Together with my husband Joachim we created this place situated in 'Machariuswijk' in the city center of Ghent. Urban Loft offers two private rooms with both their own private terrace and bathroom (both can be reserved separately).

If you like to enjoy, relax and discover Ghent
If you like to start your discovery in a unique place (building, room, environment)
If you are a food lover & desire to discover more?

--> Meaning common ground <--

Urban Loft is your spot.
neighborhood_overview:
We are situated in a very unique part of Ghent. Unique in a way that we live within the city center of Ghent amongst a true diversity AND very close to transport possibilities, including railway station (Gent Dampoort) which is in fact the true main station as it is the closest to the city center.

This neighbourhood offers also nice restaurants and places to discover without being annoyed by too many people or noises.
From this place you can discover anything you want within the city center on foot. If you like to explore it differently you can, there are places where you can rent a bike, boat, stand up paddle, ...

You receive our personal recommendations and information in a brochure we have made for our guests. You receive this upon your arrival or earlier.

name: Private bedroom in Art (D)eco apartment.
description:
Our apartment is situated close to the city center, with lots of busses stopping in front of the door and the Dampoort train station only 15 minutes walk away. The building is from 1940, and most aspects of our apartment are still original. Therefore it is quite important that you are considerate and treat our place with care :-)
The guest bedroom is all yours, the other places in the house are shared but we are often away in the daytime so you can enjoy plenty of privacy, also in the garden.
neighborhood_overview: We have plenty of grocery shops in the street and in the neighborhood, a pharmacy around the corner, banks on the other side of the street, some decent restaurants and a nice bar.
host_about:
Hallo, ik ben Jorid, airbnb-host sinds 2015. Vlak voor corona zijn mijn vriend en ik verhuisd, waardoor we een paar jaar geen airbnb hebben gedaan. We misten de gasten en zetten daarom terug onze (nieuwe) woonst open.
We zijn allebei vegan- en plasticfree-minded, hebben zelf geen wagen en zijn zeer bewust van onze impact, maar verwachten dit niet zozeer van jou, zolang je dit simpelweg respecteert :-) We hopen vooral dat je je thuis voelt bij ons.

name: Imagine! Sleeping in the centre of Medieval Ghent
description:
Burgstraat 17 is an old Patrician house constructed in 1515. Later the house was split in 2 houses and became neglected for many years. In 2019 we started the renovation, with as only purpose, to keep the soul and respect the history and grandeur of the original house.
Its exceptional history, unique architecture and central position made it worth doing so.
Tears, joy and a lot of work resulted in the place where you are right now. We hope you enjoy and respect this place as much as we do.
neighborhood_overview: The accomodation is located in the car free centre, in the middle of many romantic restaurants , typical bars,  historical buildings such as the Gravensteen, Korenmarkt, Graslei, .... and the shopping area. The parking is reachable by car. Normal electricity is available for charging.

name: Tranquil Urban Escape: 2-BDR Retreat in Ghent
description: This clean and trendy apartment 2 bedroom apartment with terrace is perfect for leisure or for business stays if you need to be in or around Belgium. It is equipped with all the necessary amenities for you to enjoy (either short stay or medium stay). It has easy access to al nearby highways, a tram line that runs straight to the city centre of Ghent and this while being in a quiet neighbourhood. The apartment is also located close to a supermarket and there is free parking on the premises.
neighborhood_overview: Its located in the suburbs of Ghent with easy access to every highway that lead you to Brussels (40 min), Antwerp (40 min), Bruges (30 min), Courtrai (30 min)  and Ypres (40 min). The tram line that stops near the apartment brings you to the city centre in 20min or if you go by bike it takes you 15-20 min. Ghent EXPO is 5-10min drive and the technology park in Ghent is practically walking distance.
host_about:
Ghent is an awesome European City to visit, there is always something to do and to visit. Thats why I  would love to share my apartment with people who want to explore a medieval city with a touch of trendy.
I am self-employed at this moment and an everlasting student of knowledge and I hope we can meet during one of your stays.

name: Cozy stay in the Historic centre of Ghent
description:
Our trendy accommodation is located in the centre of Ghent. The main market square is only 100 meters away.
There's a private bathroom with toilet, shower and sink.
We offer free Wifi and television.
Public parking "Vrijdagsmarkt" is nearby to park your car: 23€/24h.

There's an efficient check-in/-out process

We look forward to have you stay over with us!
neighborhood_overview: The accommodation can't be more central (!), located in a very calm alley between the waterside and one of the main shopping streets. Korenmarkt, Vrijdagsmarkt, Gravensteen all super close... The ideal hideout to explore thé most beautiful city of Belgium.
host_about:
Hi, we are Astrid and Gilles, 27 and 33. Born and raised in Moorslede and Bruges, we studied in Ghent and in Brussels. We fell in love and decided to settle in the beautiful city of Ghent. Whilst looking for a place to live, we bumped into what could be considered as one of the most centralised houses of Ghent. The house was old, dark and didn’t catch a lot of sunlight, but we saw a lot of possibilities to transform it into a little paradise in the ancient centre, close to all the hip and trendy places this city has to offer. As we travel a lot ourselves, we think we know what it takes to have a pleasant stay and discovering new cities and countries. We transformed the house in an ideal place for friends and guests visiting Ghent. By the summer of 2020 the house was finished.   
We hope you enjoy it as much as we do. 
Welcome in Ghent! 
Astrid & Gilles

name: Unique experience - spacious boathouse near center
description:
Cosy yet spacious and warmly decorated design appartment at my house boat, the Aurelia Feria.

- a 15min walk to the city center and at 2min walk from the train station.

- Outdoor area with lounge chairs on the water, by the bicycle -and walking path around the new area of Ghent Center: de Nieuwe dokken, with at the end a beach.

- Very comfy double bed in a separated room with a beautiful bathtub by the water, on the water, to be in the water.
neighborhood_overview:
The boat is located at the entrance of the 'new docks' (Nieuwe Dokken), an area just next to the center where in the past this was an industrial area, operating over water.
This whole area (that used to be 'the old docks') has recently been developed (and still is) with areas to live, schools, open space, playground, beach, bars, cycling path, walking path, etc. New neighboorhood that due to Corona is now also being discovered by the Ghentians, for walking and cycling, and for water activities. It is still a quiet place so close to the city, train station and the ring of Ghent. But fun on the water (lots of kayaking, little boats, rubber boats, paddle boarding) is popular nowadays and it comes close, since you are also on the water ,-) and people are curious to see life on a boat.

The boat is next to a quay and a cycling path. There is no car road, only a simple road where residents can load and unload the car, as can you if you come with the car.

Unfortun
host_about:
Hi, I am Lies and i lived on the houseboat with my 2 children for a couple of years. I still live in Ghent, but not on the boat anymore. .  

 I bought the Aurelia Feria end of 2017. It is a 'spits', used to be a cargo boat of 40 m long and was build end of the 60's.

name: Design waterfront apartment in central Ghent
description:
Waterfront appartement 1st floor, 4 rooms around (3 en suite, 1 separate bathroom across the landing). This means the entire first floor is yours! Splendid view on the tree lined canal in front of the house. Sleeps 4. Bedroom, bedroom/sitting room, kitchen with dining area; Bathroom with walk-in shower. Views across Ghent. All mod cons including high speed wifi (218 Mbps).
For a comfortable stay it can host up to 3 adults or 2 adults + 2 younger children.
neighborhood_overview: We love our home in our tree lined street ! From your apartment you will be looking out over the canal. Since the city launched a marina (Portus Ganda) nearby, the neighbourhood has enjoyed a revival. Moreover, we had the first cycling street of the country. It's a very nice neighbourhood, green and quiet and yet close to trendy restaurants, theatres, the shopping areas and museums.

name: City house, completely equipped
description: Want to experience Ghent as a local? Here you get a whole, completely furbished and equipped house, so you can enjoy the city. We lived here for 7 years and left the house as it is, including toys for kids etc. You can use everything. The house is in a neighborhood just outside the centre, tram stop T1 is a very short walk away; there is also a bus stop nearby. We have AC on the top floor in the big bedroom and mobile AC in the bedroom on the 2nd floor. Beware: steep stairs to go to 3rd floor!
neighborhood_overview: The neigborhood used to be a working-class area for the workers in the nearby factories who were all closed in the nineties. The area is now in an upward spiral, as it is close to the centre. Lots of young families are moving in. It is also very multicultural. There are lots of shops and restaurants too. And also lots of green parks and areas.

name: "Desk till Dawn"
description:
Spacious duplex designer apartment with roof terrace.

The ultimate enjoyment of this apartment is that it's spacious. It is 175 m2 including the terrace. All living spaces are accurate and surprisingly connected to each other. You don't have to share it with anyone except the presence of our plant collection.

On request, there is private parking and you can use our own bicycles. Experience more in less time !

Train and bus are nearby.
neighborhood_overview:
A wide range of essential amenities are available in the neighborhood.

In addition to the presence of our beloved historic city center, we find the Rozenbroekepark the most fun in our neighborhood. The entrance to that park is 350 meters It contains a densely forested area with older trees and also open areas. Perfect to start or close the day with a fresh nose.
There are Finnish slopes laid out for the sports enthusiasts but also narrow asphalt and concrete roads for the cyclists and hikers. A playground is also provided. At the end of the park, 1.5 km walking from the apartment, there is the Olympic swimming pool (Lago Rozenbroeken). There are also wellness opportunities and recreational baths with slides.

Nice terrace with lots of greenery. 2 large bedrooms, 1 bedroom with double bed. 1 large bedroom with 2 double beds (1 on the mezzanine, 1 double sofa bed). Bathroom with shower and bath. Within walking distance of the center. This is our own house, we rent this out when we are not there ourselves.
host_about: Living in Ghent, renting our place when we are traveling.

name: Appartment Keizerpark
description:
The studio is the complete top floor of my house, full privacy.
Part of the stairs, hallway and frontdoor is shared. The appartement has 3 separate rooms: the bathroom with rainshower, toilet, sink; the kitchen/livingroom with kitchen and a comfy couch plus TV on the mezzanine; the bedroom/study with a desk and a bed on a mezzanine. There is lots of natural light in the kitchen and bedroom. The kitchen is brandnew, with a cappuccinomachine, an electric ketle, an oven, induction hobs and more.
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a nice quiet neighbourhood. There is a park by the water, 2minutes walkingdistance. There is also a nature reserve 10minutes walking away, where you can go for a run or just enjoy nature. We live close to the water so nice scenery's all around. (I can give some good tips for nice jogging routes!)
Public transport is very acessible from our house and can bring you to the station, the citycenter or where ever. The highway is also easy acces, E17,E40 and R4.
Shops of all sorts, gasstations, nightshops, supermarkets are at walkingdistance.
From our house you can walk to the citycenter, a nice route that follows the water. 15minutes walk.

name: Casa Violetta
description:
Casa Violetta is within walking distance of all the sights in Ghent center. The apartment is fully equipped: kitchen, bathroom with shower, bedroom with television set and fast wifi.
For guests who come to the city by car, we can provide a secure parking space in the street for a fee (15€ per day).
neighborhood_overview: We work in town ourselves and our son goes around the corner to school. The neighborhood has a lot of cozy restaurants and bars. Breakfast is available on site, but just as easy in coffee bars and breakfast options within walking distance. There is a cozy cinema on the corner. Shops and supermarkets are nearby.
host_about:
We're a couple in our thirties and just got the nicest son! Just before Edgar was born we lived in the apartment ourselves for three years. Now we live next door. We love travelling and now we started a family, we hope to enjoy the visits of other people exploring our beloved city: GENT
Whoever visits Ghent for the first time or even more, will hear us tell enthousistic about where to go to eat, to walk, to see and visit ...

name: A beautiful and quiet haven
description:
Marie and Tom would like to host you in their house in Ghent and guarantee you a comfortable stay and warm welcome.
Tom is a notorious chef, his restaurant ‘Haven' is just around the corner.
Marie is a notorious mom and loves all things tasty and adventurous.
We love to do things with passion, with taste and with our heart.
We both love traveling and at the same time we are in love with the city of Ghent.
It is beautiful.
It is pleasant.
There is so much to see and do in this historical city!

Free parking on Afrikalaan just about 4-5mins walk to the flat.
Paid underground parking available next to appt 10.50€ for 24hrs

Aye!
Along the banks of the Scheldt, we put the master bedroom of our houseboat for rent for a stay of at least 2 nights. You will be within walking distance of the historic beautiful Ghent, quietly floating in a green area.

The house is within walking distance of the historic center of the city (5 min. to Gravensteen).
The house has a lot of light and a city garden facing south. The room (and accompanying terrace) is located on the first floor.

name: Charming studio 300m from Gent St Pieters Station
description: Charming studio  fully equipped, 300 meters walk from Gent Sint Pieter station (Gand Saint Pierre), with two large windows facing the park Delphine Boël, 10 mn walk from the SMAK museum, tramway stop at the door step of the building going to the old city center, close to all food shops and traiteurs, space to park bicycle inside, 50 meters from car parking lot.
neighborhood_overview:
Ghent is a beautiful city in Belgium with many interesting tourist attractions. Here's a suggested tourist circuit:

1. Gravensteen Castle: Start by visiting this iconic medieval castle that offers a panoramic view of the city.

2. Saint Bavo's Cathedral: Explore this majestic cathedral where you can admire the famous Ghent Altarpiece by the Van Eyck brothers.

3. Graslei and Korenlei: Take a stroll along these picturesque medieval streets lined with stunning historical buildings.

4. Ghent Belfry: Climb to the top of the belfry for a breathtaking view of Ghent.

5. Museum of Fine Arts (MSK): Discover a collection of art spanning from the Middle Ages to the early 20th century.

6. Patershol Quarter: Enjoy a charming atmosphere as you wander through this neighborhood and savor local specialties at its restaurants.

7. Saint Nicholas' Church: Visit this imposing Gothic church located near Korenmarkt.

8. STAM

name: Recently renovated mini-mansion in Ghent.
description:
This centrally located accommodation is tastefully decorated. The 2nd floor is completely at the disposal of guests. 2 fully equiped bedrooms.

You share the bathroom with me on the first floor (if I'm there that is). There is a jet stream bath, 2 sinks and a separate shower. On the first floor there is also a separate guest toilet.

I like to travel across Europe, when I have more money i'll go further away :)

Interests: photography, modern art, good coffee, history, long walks, snowboarding...

name: Guesthouse with natural vibe - bikes included
description:
Guest cottage with a brand new, sparkling clean bathroom, in a quiet suburb 4 km from downtown. You’ll share the wild garden with us, but the cottage is exclusive to you. With the two bikes that are included in your stay, the Korenmarkt is a mere 15 minutes away. Bakery, butcher, supermarket and cafés within walking distance.

Parking nearby and easy to reach by bus or tram, with stops less than 1 km away. There’s a good bus service to and from the train station Gent-Sint-Pieters.
neighborhood_overview: Mariakerke is a quiet leafy suburb. Most of our guests hop on a tram shortly after they arrive or take the bikes to the city center, only a fifteen minute ride, but in the neighborhood you’ll find a bakery, butcher, supermarket, a handful of good bars and restaurants, and beautiful bits of nature such as the reserve Bourgoyen-Ossemeersen or Vyncke-Bovyn, the prettiest litle city park in Ghent.

name: Gezellige slaapkamer aan de rand van Gent
description:
Come and enjoy this newly renovated bedroom close to the center. Located close to an official ‘P&R’, parking is free and there are many options to go in 10 minutes by public transport to the center of Ghent. By foot you walk around 40 minutes.

The room is located in a rather quiet neighbourhood with little tourist attractions. Perfect for who wants to visit the city, but prefers a more quiet sleeping environment with free parking spaces in the street.
neighborhood_overview:
With this place you deliberately don't choose the center. You will find yourself in a suburb right next to a green lung, close to both public transport and highways, and even by bike only 10 minutes from the tourist center.

Ideal for those who want to retreat after a day's city. Or for those looking for an accessible place outside the busy center for work/study.

Free parking nearby is a windfall!
host_about:
Hi all

I’m Bert, a plantbased guy living in Ghent and working in the European capital. I have a coaching business at home and work also as a lecturer and researcher for the amazing Brussels Erasmus University of Applied Sciences, I travel a lot over the European continent and use Airbnb or my volkswagen van to do so. 
Renting out rooms makes it possible for me to live in Ghent and own a house. But mostly to meet amazing new people. See you soon?

This is a 2 bedroom apartment. Guests will enjoy easy access to everything in the apartment.

name: Spacious room in old townhouse (partly renovated)
description:
You like it cosy?

I’m renting out a room with garden view for short term periods. Check also my other listings!

For me, Airbnb is (still) a way to travel 'with locals'. The house is not a modern all-in hotel, neither is it an investment property. It's a cosy house with creaking stairs and Airbnb helps me safe some money for future renovations and for saving for a fund for my kids college (single mom of 1,5 year old twins).

If you like the charm of an old authentic house, you'll love this.

I'm a mother of one year old twins, renting out a room in our own family home. Ghent can be crowded, and so can be the hotels and hostels, therefore I see renting out a part of my private house as a great opportunity for both guest and host. But for obvious reasons we do not allow party people, extra guests, pets,... 
We respect guests and expect respect (silence and cleanliness) in return!

name: Modern ruim appartement direct aan station Gent SP
description: From our centrally located apartment, the cozy lively Ghent is within easy reach. The location just outside Ghent-Sint-Pieters Station means that you have connections by train, tram, bus and taxi, just outside the door (1 min). The cozy and safe neighborhood offers a 7/7 supermarket, shops, bars, restaurants, night shop (all at 1 min) and a green city park with playground in the immediate vicinity. The street is low traffic and therefore remarkably quiet. The apartment offers all the comforts.
neighborhood_overview: Our cozy apartment is really ideally located just at the Station Gent-Sint-Pieters. The transport connections are absolutely excellent. The station neighborhood is a nice, neat and safe neighborhood. The neighborhood has a lot of great bars and restaurants. Also the supermarkets and night shops in the street of the accommodation are all of a fine quality. The historic Citadel Park is a 5-minute walk away. A short walk (10 min) takes you to the green recreation area 'De Blaarmeersen' (sandy beach, playgrounds, catering and sports).

This historical monument is treated with the necessary respect and restored by Rietveldprojects.be.
It as converted in 2020 into 3 apartments and 1 bakery on the ground floor. Each apartment is available only 4 months of the year and is used by the owners for the remaining 8 months. Super central location, from each apartment you have a view on the historical buildings such as the Gerard de Duivelsteen of the 13theC.

name: Lichtrijke slaapkamer met ensuite badkamer
description:
Welcome to our terraced house in the city district of Ledeberg, on the edge of the center of Ghent.

From here you can discover the historic city of Ghent by tram, bus, bicycle or on foot. The tram stop is on a bend of the front door. Within 10 minutes you're in the heart of the city.

We offer you a double bedroom with own bathroom on the second floor of the house. The room is located on the attic floor, so keep the stairs in mind!
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is located in a quiet street in Ledeberg, a city district on the edge of the center of Ghent.

Nearby you will find a supermarket, deep fryer, bakery and butcher. Also some small cafes and dining areas. On Sundays, there is a large market on Ledebergplein every week.

The nicest and most beautiful places and addresses, of course, can be found in the historic center of Ghent.

With the bus or tram stop a 2-minute walk away, you are a stone's throw from the heart of the City of Ghent.

By bike, about ten minutes by foot, about twenty minutes.

Enjoy the Arteveldestad in all its aspects. A terrace in our car-free city, a beautiful walk along the historic buildings, a bike ride along the Leie, a visit to the Lam Gods in St. Bavo's Cathedral, a tour of the Stedelijk Museum for Actual Art (Squeak). Here you can experience it all in the most cozy city of Flanders.

name: Villa Lyntjesland - Centrum Gent!
description: Bright and cozy townhouse with outdoor space and desk within walking distance of the Korenmarkt!
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a bustling part of Ghent with 2 supermarkets 5 minutes walk + some neighborhood shops that are also on Sunday.
Butcher, bakery also 2 minutes walk.
Cafes, restaurant 5 to 10 minutes walk.
Large and small shopping street a 10 minute walk away.
host_about:
Hi! 
Ik ben Lyn, Limburger, Gentenaar, trotse Belg maar vooral wereldburger! Ik hou van reizen en ontdekken. 
Samen met mijn vriend, woon ik deels in Gent, deels in Lommel; vandaar dat onze beide huizen op AirBnb staan; daarnaast reizen we veel; 
Reizen en gezelligheid zijn heel belangrijk voor mij en dat deel ik graag met onze gasten! 
Tips nodig? Ik help je graag op weg. 
Fijne vakantie alvast en hopelijk tot binnenkort! <3

name: Pleasant Studio in Ghent's Urban core
description: Explore Ghent from our charming studio. Close to Graslei, Korenmarkt, and cultural sites, it has a queen bed, kitchenette, bathroom, and Netflix. This property it's perfect for history and culture enthusiasts wanting a cozy, central stay in the heart of medieval Ghent. Book your stay and immerse yourself in the authentic charm of this captivating city.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this
medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and
cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century
majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic
city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral
and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an
intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine
Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late
Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the
Museum of Contempora
host_about: Hi i'm tony,  I’m an easy going and caring guy who loves to meet new people. I’ve stayed at Airbnb’s all over the world and have met some great people on the platform who I now call my friends.

name: Optimized Duplex in the Heart of Ghent
description: Discover our duplex in Ghent's heart, perfect for 4. With a queen bed, sofa-bed, and full bathroom, it blends comfort with urban living. Steps from attractions, bars, and restaurants, enjoy the city's energy, then retreat to tranquility. Ideal for families or friends, it's your gateway to Ghent's charm.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this
medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and
cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century
majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic
city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral
and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an
intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine
Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late
Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the
Museum of Contempora

name: City centre quiet & private garden house
description: This lovely holiday house  is located in the back garden of a remarkable four story apartment building by the hand of architects Vens Vanbelle. The wide range of gastronomic delights, trendy shops and cultural highlights are at stone's throw. Welcome to Ghent!
neighborhood_overview: We are located in the quiet and safe neighbourhood called 'Prinsenhof' with picturesque streets and the river Lieve running through it. host_about:
I’m Mechiel and I enjoy delicious drinks and food, a night out with friends, travelling, cycling and good music.
Three year ago I started this BnB and it’s been a pleasure welcoming all kinds of people regardless of colour, gender, sexual orientation or religion.
I’ve lived and worked in Ghent for many years, so I have quite some tips & tricks for visitors. 
I hope to make your visit to Ghent unforgettable!

name: Ideal Family Retreat in Ghent
description: This clean and trendy apartment 2 bedroom apartment with terrace is perfect for leisure or for business stays if you need to be in or around Belgium. It has easy access to al nearby highways, a tram line that runs straight to the city centre of Ghent and this while being in a quiet neighbourhood. The apartment is also located close to a supermarket and there is free parking on the premises.
neighborhood_overview: Its located in the suburbs of Ghent with easy access to every highway that lead you to Brussels (40 min), Antwerp (40 min), Bruges (30 min), Courtrai (30 min)  and Ypres (40 min). Ghent EXPO is 5-10min drive and the technology park in Ghent is practically walking distance.

name: Studio Tzawel : private downtown Gent
description:
This recognized holiday home (** *) is located on the ground floor of our 1890s house in a quiet street in the city center of Ghent. 75 meters away there is already a first (and popular) restaurant, moreover more choice at 350 meters away in the Patershol. Numerous shops nearby.

The space is spacious (60m²) and there is an outdoor area to place trash. Private acces to the studio. Only the hallway was shared with my family.

host_about:
Search Studio Tzawel Gent in Googlemaps or Youtube  for info.

Hello, I like holiday :-) I like different people/cultures/habits... I speak Dutch, but also French & English  + some words & expressions of Spanish.

I offered a room in a Belgian village in 2013 but now I am offering a private studio in our house in Gent city Center!

name: Modern Long Stay Apartment: Work & Relax (Ghent)
description:
A Home, Away From Home in Ghent

Remote workers, digital nomads, expats, PhD students,... will love my modern apartment:
- Great coffee machine
- Fast internet
- Dedicated work space and desk with extra screen
- Awesome entertainment (Sonos, huge TV, colour lights)
- Great location close to the centre of Ghent
- Bicycle included (to discover the area ;) )
- Close to Gentbrugse Meersen (Park)

Welcome to the perfect place to work (remotely) in Ghent, while also having plenty of options to relax.
neighborhood_overview:
Close to the city center of Ghent (just outside), you'll find Gentbrugge. A quiet area with plenty of young families. It's an upcoming and popular area because its location: Close to the city and easy access to the highway, plus a green area with the Gentbrugse Meersen (huge nature reserve).

Also 3 supermarkets within a 3-min walk and a convenience store just around the corner (everyday open till 12am) that sells sandwiches (Panos, ideal for lunch)
host_about:
Hi,

I'm Jochen and I'm renting out my apartment to like-minded people. 

I also had the pleasure to work remotely, and I loved it! That's why I'm making my apartment available for guests who are looking to stay a longer time in Ghent and don't want to worry about the comfort, while working abroad.

In the meantime It also allows me to travel the world as a digital nomad as well.

Looking forward to have you staying in my great apartment and let's share experiences!

name: Cosy private floor in the green belt of Ghent
description:
Well situated for those who enjoy peace, yet only 5 km away from the medieval city of Ghent, which is easily accessible by bike or public transportation. 150 m away there are bus stops which regularly go to the city centre and its train station(s). Closeby are the ramps leading to Bruges, the sea and Brussels. Within walking distance of the wonderful "Parkbos" and the picturesque village of St Martens-Latem.
On the 2nd floor you gain access to a bedroom, a spacious bathroom and a living room.
neighborhood_overview:
Everything is within close reach: the "Parkbos", leisure boat trips on the Lys, the artist's village of St Martens-Latem/Deurle en yet still close to the lively city of Ghent. In addition, there are several travel destinations relatively closeby: the North Sea coast, Bruges, Brussels and Antwerp.

Within a radius of 4 km you can find many different eating, drinking and shopping opportunities.

name: Medieval Hide-Out in the Heart of Ghent Center
description: Uncover the charm of Ghent from our 1-bedroom unique apartment, strategically nestled in the heart of this captivating city. Immerse yourself in its key location, where the best attractions and sightseeing opportunities are just steps away. Positioned in the bustling center of Ghent, this apartment offers unparalleled convenience, ensuring you can explore the city's treasures with ease.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this
medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and
cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century
majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic
city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral
and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an
intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine
Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late
Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the
Museum of Contempora
host_about: Hi i'm tony,  I’m an easy going and caring guy who loves to meet new people. I’ve stayed at Airbnb’s all over the world and have met some great people on the platform who I now call my friends.

name: Sunny stay with artist + sweet cat
description:
Welcome to my flat! It's is a bright, cozy, creative, and fun place to stay 10 min walking from the city center.

I live by myself, with my super sweet 3-legged cat & rent out a spare bedroom with own bathroom.

The bedroom is very relaxing; it includes black-out curtains, comfy mattress/sheets, my Ghent tips... Everything for a great stay! You also have your own bathroom with a shower and sink.

You can use the common areas as well. I love to meet new people and am super easy going! :)
neighborhood_overview:
I live in a vibrant, multicultural street right next to the heart of the city center of Ghent
- In 5 minutes walking you're in the city center. 10 minutes walking and you're at the Castle.
- There's a supermarket at the end of the street (Lidl) as well as a take-out pita that's open late at night. At the other end of the street there's a take-out BBQ place and a laundry place.
- The street behind me is full of restaurants and bakeries
- 5 minutes walking you're at the waterfront where there's a shopping mall and great coffee shops.

I will happily help you navigate around to whatever you need!

You can park on the street or in the indoor parking "Tolhuis" one block away (both are paying).
host_about:
Hi there! I am Judith, a warm, fun, all round creative. I work as a consultant in the technology world and draw often in my free time. You will find many of my art works on my walls. I used to live in San Francisco, Dublin, Paris before returning back home, to beautiful Ghent! In the mean time I also adopted a sweet 3-legged cat.

I speak English and Dutch natively. And I can have a conversation in French as well!

name: Basic room with big bed near city center
description:
A perfect place to start your discovery of the city.

There is (paid) parking near the house and bike rental options.

Although the house is located in a very vivid area of town, you can enjoy the peacefulness and quietness at all times as the rooms are located in the back of the house, with a view of the large garden.
host_about:
I'm a mother of one year old twins, renting out a room in our own family home. Ghent can be crowded, and so can be the hotels and hostels, therefore I see renting out a part of my private house as a great opportunity for both guest and host. But for obvious reasons we do not allow party people, extra guests, pets,... 
We respect guests and expect respect (silence and cleanliness) in return!

name: 3-Bedroom Penthouse in a UNESCO Heritage Beguinage
description:
Unique opportunity to stay in a UNESCO beguinage from 1660 - very close to all key attractions.
Located in a beautiful peaceful neighbourhood in the heart of Gent, this is a unique, stylish and spacious space. 200sq meters, with the 17th-century architecture preserved and enhanced by modern design.
Large cosy living room, fully equipped kitchen, 2 double bedrooms each with a separate bathroom. More guests can sleep on a comfy airbed in a 3rd room. Patio at your disposal to enjoy some fresh air!
neighborhood_overview:
In the heart of the Ghentian Beguinage; red little houses with white accents, located around a park with a church in the middle.
It's within walking distance of Ghent's highlights, while being very calm and quiet at night; perfect for a deliciously good nights' rest.
host_about: I am currently living in Gent, Belgium with my fiancé Fabian! My biggest passion is travelling, I love to explore and discover new places, cultures, natural sites, cuisines. I enjoy cooking and I'm a big foodie and wine lover. I can speak Russian, English, French and Dutch.

description:
Discover a luminous Airbnb gem in the heart of Ghent!

This spacious apartment is flooded with natural light, which creates a welcoming atmosphere. Located in the lively Oudburgwijk, known for its restaurants and charming streets, this Airbnb offers the perfect starting point for your adventures in Ghent.
neighborhood_overview: What makes our apartment so unique is that it is located in the famous Oudburg street. Because there are the best restaurants and famous historic buildings in this street, it will be one of your visit items when you come to Ghent! This street is located in the historic center and is known for its conviviality. Every day you can enjoy beautiful local restaurants, cozy bars and local products. Because you can stay in such a unique and well coveted place, there can sometimes be some noise from a restaurant. But this up to max 12 hours.

name: Stunning Duplex Apartment in Ghent Center
description: Immerse in Ghent's energy with our central duplex. Ideal for exploring city landmarks and hidden gems, it's near cafes and boutiques. With one bedroom and a capacity to hold up to four guests, this apartment offers more than just a stay, it's a deep dive into the city's rhythm. Perfect for those seeking an authentic Ghent experience, where every step reveals a new discovery.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this
medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and
cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century
majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic
city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral
and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an
intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine
Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late
Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the
Museum of Contempora
host_about: Hi i'm tony,  I’m an easy going and caring guy who loves to meet new people. I’ve stayed at Airbnb’s all over the world and have met some great people on the platform who I now call my friends.

name: Private 2 room apartment in Ghent's greenest area
description: Unique, soothing accommodation. Fully furnished. Very suitable for long-term stays. Enjoy the green surroundings. Uniquely located along the greenest part of the Ghent cycling ring, close to the nature reserve, and 12 minutes cycling through the countryside to the historic city center. Direct tram connection to the city center (15 minutes) and train station Gent Sint-Pieters (25 minutes) at 60 meters from the house.
neighborhood_overview:
At the back of the house (block to walk) is a bicycle highway in the green and a large park. Ideal for nature- and sun lovers. Both the historic city center and nature reserve Bourgoyen are only 12 minutes bicycles.
Wondergem is a nice coffee bar nearby, where you can also eat.
host_about: Hi, I'm a documentary filmmaker and journalist, traveling the world. Renting out my own place too, in Ghent, Belgium. Happy to receive you and give you ideas of where to go in our beautiful city.

You are very welcome in our cozy apartment close to the historic city center.

name: Nyte estate. Rural familyhouse (4-12p) near Ghent.
description: Nyte is a rural estate of 1ha on a biking distance of the city centre of Ghent. The main house (built in 2011) was extended with a luxury 2-bedroom guesthouse in 2019. Together it makes a holiday house for up to 12 people. It is surrounded by a private garden and open fields. It is accessible only through a 150m entrance road from the street.  Eventually the 2-bedroom guesthouse can be rented separately for a small family. If you wish so, please contact the owner for pricing.
neighborhood_overview: The Neighborhood is a rural living center. The house is in the back, 150m from the public road and in the middle of the fields. Full privacy, no direct neighbors.

name: Gezellig rijhuis in Gent met tuintje
description: Welcome to our house in Meibloemstraat - Brugse Poort, Ghent. It is located just 2 kilometers from the center of Ghent, and is located in a very social, cool neighborhood. So ideal to explore Ghent. Our home itself is very quiet and offers lots of nice spots to relax. Perfect to relax and unwind after a day in Ghent.
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is located in the Brugse Poort, Ghent. It is located only 2 kilometer from Ghent city center. The Brugse Poort is a quite cool, social neighborhood. In our street there is a local grocery shop Akker&Ambacht and De Meubelfabriek where often fun activities go on. De Kur is also located in our street. Here you can go for fun performances and parties. If you are interested in fun performances, take a look at the site of Bij’ De Vieze Guests.
There are a lot of cool eateries nearby such as Woest, Superkelly and Eethuis Karoot. Café Congé is definitely our regulars:), and ideal for having a drink among locals.
Good to know is that it is a very quiet neighborhood, and that despite there is a lot to do, there is not much (night)noise.
Our street opens onto a cool park, the Kokerpark, where you are definitely welcome on Friday nights for an aperitif.
The park "De Groene Vallei" is also close by.
Only 3 kilometers away is the natural park "De Bourgoyen".

description: This cozily furnished room is located on the ground floor overlooking the shared city garden. name: Herenhuiskamer Schoolstraat
description:
The room is a private space on the 1st floor of a mansion. The house is inhabited by the owner.
The space has its own kitchen. The room is furnished like a small living area. The bathroom and toilet are communal. 25 min walk to Ghent and 10 min to Dampoort station. Public transportation behind the corner.
Parties are not allowed and party cottages are not welcome.
neighborhood_overview:
The space is close to the Dampoort station and 25 minutes walk from De Kuip, the historic heart, of Ghent.
In all directions are different restos and shops.
After 150 meters you walk through the gate of the Groot Begijnhof of Sint-Amandsberg - an oasis of peace in the hustle and world heritage. Further down is the Campo Santo cemetery, the Père Lachaise of Ghent.
Around the corner is the Rozenbroekenpark and a subtropical pool annex welness. The Copacabana Summer Festival will take place here in June. Around the other corner you can "Dancing in 't Park" in the Azaleapark from August 19-21.

name: Charming Master Bedroom near Ghent
description:
This nice place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit. You can take the train to Dampoort train station, from where it's 5 by bus. Or you can come by car and park safely on the street (for free).

name: Charming Studio in Ghent’s Heart
description: Step into our luminous and well-appointed studio nestled in the heart of Ghent, accommodating up to 4 guests. This vibrant location places you at the core of the city's dynamic energy, offering easy access to Ghent's most iconic attractions. Immerse yourself in the medieval charm of the city by making this bright and complete studio your home. There's no better place to experience the essence of Ghent than right in its beating heart.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this
medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and
cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century
majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic
city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral
and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an
intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine
Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late
Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the
Museum of Contempora

name: Amazing  Tipi experience! Nature & Culture Gent 💚
description:
Feëriek, unique experience. Sleep in an authentic tipi in nature and a stone's throw from the historic center. You enjoy your own place in our mini forest and cozy outdoor kitchen. Experience an atmosphere that's unique and make your own campfire.
On request, the host can teach you the secrets of bushcraft and make you a Rocket stove together. You can use all the comforts of your own private bathroom and there is also a small cozy outdoor bath. Welcome enjoy slow living!

name: Jacob’s Getaway - Spacious App - City Center
description: Unwind in this spacious and gracefully renovated studio. Everything you need is right here:  kingsize beds, separate sofa beds, a large shower, a separate toilet, a washing machine, a well equipped kitchen with oven/microwave and a charming living room with television. This clean getaway is the perfect spot to discover stunning Ghent by foot. This apartment is located above a well known Belgian restaurant. You can order and eat on your own apartment, great right?!
neighborhood_overview: Jacob’s Getaway is located right in the heart of the city centre. Everything is in walking distance. To name a few things: restaurants, bars, the castle, all tourist attractions, the canals, all musea, cinemas, parks, a swimming pool, bike rental, boat rental, kayak rental, … No doubt about it, this spot is the perfect choice to start your day and wander around the historic streets.

name: Renovated Double Bedroom in Ghent
description:
Welcome to your stylish and comfortable stay in Ghent!
- 2 separate bedrooms with a large 2-person bed in each room.
- Newly renovated interior located in a quiet street.
- Self check-in available 24/7 for your convenience.
- Central location, 1 min from Vrijdagsmarkt, 5 min to Korenmarkt & Kouter.
- Only a 10 min walk to the train station and near the biggest car parking (Parking Vrijdagsmarkt).
- Your host is always available for assistance.
neighborhood_overview:
Best neighborhood in Ghent city center, no doubt! 1min from Vrijdagsmarkt, 5min from Korenmarkt & Kouter with all the shopping streets & restaurants in between. Train station only 10min walk away.
Biggest central car parking (Parking Vrijdagsmarkt) just around the corner.
This is vibrating Ghent!
host_about:
Born in Ghent, raised in Bruges. Came back to Ghent 6 years ago to open a contemporary art gallery on the ground floor of an old house in the historic centre of Ghent.

I see myself as someone with a natural joy of life. I love to meet new people that share the same enthusiasm.

I can enjoy a weekend city trip as much as a month traveling around on the other side of the world. 

As your host, I will gladly help you with any kind of problem.

name: Mooi appartement op wandelafstand van het centrum
description: Modern 1-bedroom apartment in trendy neighborhood (site Dok Noord) with all amenities nearby (shops, restaurants, coffee shop, ...), 10 min walk from the historical center. Everything is available: kitchen with appliances (including dishwasher), bathroom with walk-in shower, washing machine available. Bicycle rental and (paying) parking on the premises. Quietly located and yet close to the city center. There are several parks and plenty of relaxation options on the property.
neighborhood_overview:
On the site of Dok Noord, the factories of ACEC (electromechanics) of Ghent's industrial history wrote. They have now made way for a combination of modern housing units, offices, shops, sports and leisure shops and a fascinating food hall. During this development, new buildings have been integrated and combined with existing architecture.

The courtyard of Dok Noord is also sometimes used as an event square. You can regularly enjoy performances, performances and cultural events there.

Dok Noord is located north of the cockpit, in the 19th century belt within the city ring. The site is located in the “Heilig-Kerstbuurt” about 500m from the center and south of the 19th-century districts “Voormuide” and “Muide-Meulestede”. The site is located along the Handelsdok, which is connected to the northern seaport of Ghent.

More information about the site Dok Noord where the apartment is located can be found on the website of doknoord.

name: Charming house in centre with parking
description: Located at the centre of Ghent, at the border of the car-free, historical area , this old but cosy house is a good home base for discovering this beautiful place.  It 's easily accessible by car and a free private parking is provided. The neighbourhood is called Gent Linkeroever (Ghent left banks) and is a part of town which is known for his monasteries, art schools, small shops, bars , resto's and cosy local atmosphere. The castle, cathedral, belfry, main squares are within 10 minutes walk.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is called Gent Linkeroever (Ghent left banks) and is a part of town which is known for his monasteries, art schools, small shops, bars , resto's and cosy local atmosphere.
Across the street there is a bakery. Fresh bread and croissant only a few steps away!
Just around the corner, you will find Jan Van Gent, a local hotspot bar with quirky interior and a large cozy terrace.

A cozy house in a quiet area of ​​Ghent. Just 15 minutes from the historic and vibrant city center.

The room is comfortable and equipped with everything you need for a pleasant stay. Explore the city and relax in our beautiful room after a busy day.

Also the ideal base to discover Bruges, Antwerp and Brussels.

I look forward to welcoming you!
neighborhood_overview:
Free parking in the street. 300m away there are two 11kw charging stations. Superchargers are 1,5 km from our home.

UZ Gent: 4 km
Bruges and Brussels: 52 km
Antwerp: 57 km

name: The perfect getaway in the heart of the city
description:
Welcome to my home in the center of Ghent. This is a place in the heart of the city to completely unwind.
Guests have a private bathroom and kitchen with all amenities.
This house is also suitable for working people: there are two desks and WiFi available. All hotspots of Ghent are present within 5 - 10 minutes walking distance. Stores and public transportation are also in the immediate vicinity.
Guests can check in from 16pm and check out until 10 am.
Luggage can be placed safely.

name: Ruim appartement in hartje Gent
description:
Spacious flat suitable for 2 persons, but with the possibility of creating additional sleeping space by mutual agreement. The flat has an equipped kitchen, desk, very spacious bathroom with bathtub + shower and a storage room.
Within walking distance there are numerous shops, a supermarket and restaurants. Underground parking at 200 metres.
Ghent's main attractions and numerous museums are all within a 2-kilometre radius.
The flat is located above a bar in a lively neighbourhood.

name: Zonnig en stijlvol app, terras & parkzicht!
description:
Welcome to our apartment at the Citadel Park. The apartment features a bedroom overlooking the towers of Ghent and 2 bathrooms, one of which has a hot tub and one with shower.

You can enjoy the rising sun on the terrace on the bedroom, and the afternoon/evening sun on the terrace on the living space with a view of the park.

The apartment also comes with an extra screen workspace: the ideal homeworking spot.

Always parking at the door.
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is on the Citadel Park, close to nice brunch and aperitif spots (Cozette, Pompette, Estelle, Stek,...) and a 10-minute walk from the old city center.

Easily accessible by car, and a 15-minute walk from Ghent Sint-Pieters Station (bus and tram stops nearby).

name: Contemporary Studio with Easy City Access
description: Experience the vibrant essence of Ghent from our stylish studio in the bustling Binnenstad neighborhood, a mere 15-minute stroll from the bustling city center. Perfectly positioned near iconic monuments and tranquil parks, this studio offers an ideal balance of excitement and serenity. neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting Google’s top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. name: Gezellig thuis in Gent.
description: At 800 meters from the Sint Pietersstation in Ghent, you can take a break here - or for a little longer - in complete privacy. A cozy and centrally located row house is fully at your disposal including private kitchen, private bathroom, two separate bedrooms, a sitting area and a dining room. An agency has also been provided.
neighborhood_overview:
It is so quiet here that you forget how close to the city is! The train and other public transport are abundantly present here on a stone's throw away. A little walk and you sit in the middle of the recreation area De Blaarmeersen : It is a green area with bushes, sunbathing areas and hiking trails around a central lake with a beach, a walkable hillside mountain with lookout tower, and sports infrastructure.
In short, there is something for everyone.
host_about: Wij vinden het zelf erg fijn om dicht bij de “locals” op vakantie te gaan, gewoon omdat dat échter is. Dus ook als host proberen we graag de gasten zich thuis te laten voelen in een gezellig nest.

name: Beautiful apartment Gent Museum District
description: This beautiful apartment is ideally located, near the Sint Pieters station and within walking distance of the historic center. The apartment on the third floor with a beautiful view is aimed at providing you with maximum comfort and consists of a separate bedroom, living room, fully equipped kitchen, bathroom and toilet. There are fast Wi-Fi and digital TV.
neighborhood_overview:
This city quarter is not only the hub of Ghent, it is also a surprising shopping mall and majestic district. From the Koningin Maria Hendrikaplein at the station there are wide avenues with sounding names: Koningin Elisabethlaan, Koning Albertlaan, Koningin Astridlaan,… Feel like a real royal and come shop windows past beautiful art nouveau buildings.

It is the neighborhood where most museums are located at a stone's throw (SMAK, TRUNK, ERASER, etc.). Passion and quality are paramount here. Here you will find specialized merchants in all domains: bakeries, butchers, health shops, bike dealers, fashion boutiques, hairdressers, bookstores, you name it! In the restaurants, you can eat delicious and healthy food. Sustainable shoppers can be found here you will find a packagingless shop and an organic market on Sunday mornings!
host_about: Hi there, I am Valerie, I love to host and to travel:-)

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is not only the hub of Ghent, it is also a surprising shopping whale and majestic district. From the Koningin Maria Hendrikaplein at the station there are wide avenues with sounding names: Koningin Elisabethlaan, Koning Albertlaan, Koningin Astridlaan,… Feel like a real royal and come shop windows past beautiful art nouveau buildings.

In this wartier, passion and quality are paramount. Here you will find specialized merchants in all domains: bakeries, butchers, health shops, bike dealers, fashion boutiques, hairdressers, bookstores, you name it! In the restaurants, you can eat delicious and healthy food. Sustainable shoppers can be found here you will find a packagingless shop and an organic market on Sunday mornings!

The stay sits in a quiet street just around the corner From the main station Gent-Sint Pieter's, with easy access to public transport.

In the direct proximity you can also find the museum district with main sites such as the STAM, the museum about the history of the city Ghent from early medieval times till now.
The MSK, the museum for old fine arts with all the masters such as Jordaens, Ruebens, Van Eyck and so much more. The GUM, the university museum located next to the botanical gardens with greenhouses which are free to visit.
Or the SMAK, which houses a very nice collection of modern and contemporary art with different exhibitions from time to time.

The old abbey Bijloke can be reached on a beautiful 10 -15 min walk, which brings you along the outskirts of the historic busy citycenter and all the real Ghent locations.

description: We welcome you to this apartment, ideally located for a weekend break in Ghent. neighborhood_overview:
This city quarter is not only the hub of Ghent, it is also a surprising shopping mall and majestic district. From the Koningin Maria Hendrikaplein at the station there are wide avenues with sounding names: Koningin Elisabethlaan, Koning Albertlaan, Koningin Astridlaan,… Feel like a real royal and come shop windows past beautiful art nouveau buildings.

It is the neighborhood where most museums are located at a stone's throw (SMAK, TRUNK, ERASER, etc.). Passion and quality are paramount here. Here you will find specialized merchants in all domains: bakeries, butchers, health shops, bike dealers, fashion boutiques, hairdressers, bookstores, you name it! In the restaurants, you can eat delicious and healthy food. Sustainable shoppers can be found here you will find a packagingless shop and an organic market on Sunday mornings!

name: City Comfort: Modern Studio in Ghent
description:
Discover a brightly lit apartment in this vibrant neighborhood, just under 15 minutes from Ghent's city center. Explore the city's rich history, national landmarks, museums, and parks, all within walking distance. Our property offers top-of-the-line amenities in a thoughtfully optimized space, ensuring your utmost comfort and relaxation after a day of exploring this historic city.

Inside, indulge in the perfect blend of modern comfort and thoughtful design. The apartment boasts a cozy sofa bed,
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting the Gravensteen – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

name: Art & Love Loft
description:
A Fabulous Art Space in a famous Art City.

The ´Night Asylum´ was built in 1888 as a work of charity.
Itinerants were provided with a pyjama, a bowl of soup and a bed.

After WWII the complex became a movie theatre and community center. From 2002 to 2006 it was carefully renovated into a mixture of housing forms.

The Directors' office became an architecture office, then an Art space, and now it is open for your creative / enjoyable endeavours.
neighborhood_overview:
We live in a small street with no through traffic. There is a large park (Lousbergpark) just 50 m steps away and a smaller park (Puzzle Park) at only 150m. With sofas, green, picnic tables, and playground. In the summer ideal for picnics or bbq.
The Tinkstraat is close to the water and from us you can walk along the Scheldt or direction the city along the Fishing.
The "fish district" is a quiet and pleasant neighborhood for living.
No noise and yet really super close to the heart of the city with all the restaurants, shopping and sightseeing.
host_about:
I travelled a lot when I was young, much of that by bicycle. It shifted my job from designing houses to bikes. 
Now I'm happy to welcome guests in the former Night Asylum of Ghent, built in 1888, even then with the specific mission of hosting itinerants. I hope to give back some of the hospitality I encountered.

- Yalla yalla: Lebanese

name: Spacious apartment with water canal view
description:
Spacious apartment with water canal view located at walking distance from the city centre (25-30min) and Dampoort station (20min).
Close to grocery stories, bus and tram stops.
1st bedroom with double bed and balcony. The 2nd bedroom with sofa bed and desk. Spacious, fully equipped kitchen with dining area, living room. Bathroom with shower.
Speed wifi in the entire apartment.
neighborhood_overview:
Great accesibility by car (R40), outside the LEZ, no permit needed to drive here.
Paid parking on the street, for free on Sundays and holidays.
Perfect connection if you come by train or Flixbus (18-minutes walking distance). You can rent a bike at the station as well.
20minutes by foot from downtown and marina 'Portus Ganda', which is situated next to the swimming pool and one of the most historical places in Ghent - Sint-Baafsabdij.
Around 2,5km walking distance to the historical centrum of Gent. SMAK and STAM museums around 2km by foot.
The property is located beetween water canals and parks.
If you decide to rent a bike, there is a nature reserve along the river (Schelde) with a cycling and walking trail, perfect for joggers too.
10minutes away from the supermarket, cinema and cafe's.
Very easy and safe to explore the city on foot.

This is a fantastic city to explore and the house you'll be staying in gives you perfect access to the whole city.

host_about:

I have a coaching business at home and work also as a lecturer and researcher for the amazing Brussels Erasmus University of Applied Sciences, I travel a lot over the European continent and use Airbnb or my volkswagen van to do so.

name: Charming Studio in Historic Centre Ghent
description: Step into your perfect retreat in the heart of Ghent, where the city's pulse beats just outside your door. This studio, meticulously designed for up to 4 guests, offers more than just accommodation – it's your gateway to an unforgettable Ghent experience. Immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of the historic center, where the iconic towers, the ancient castle, and the mesmerizing Mystic Lamb by the Van Eyck brothers are all within arm's reach.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this
medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and
cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century
majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic
city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral
and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an
intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine
Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late
Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the
Museum of Contempora

Ideally located right in front of a park and 20 minutes from the center of Ghent, easily accessible by bike or tram.

neighborhood_overview: Zwijnaarde is a cozy village near Ghent. We live right across the  sunflower park and the tram literally stops in front of our door. The connection with the city is therefore immediately present. Within walking distance there is the Zwijnjesbos with public food forest of which host Julie himself is the founder. Zwijnaarde has some small restaurants and bakeries. There is free parking in the streets around our house.

name: Cosy kamers dichtbij station
description:
From this charming accommodation, you can easily reach Saint-Pierre train station with shops, restaurants and cozy terraces nearby. Within walking distance of the historic center.
Two double bedrooms, each with a double bed with sofa, fridge, closet. Private bathroom with sinks, shower, bathtub and WC.
On request and for a fee, I can provide breakfirst or tasty drinks and/or snacks in the room (local beer, bottle of cava, chips, nuts or other delicacies) - feel free to ask for more information.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood near Sint-Pietersstation. You can walk and bike to the city center or use public transport (tram). In the neighbourhood there are several shops such as bakeries, butcher, caterer but also restaurants and dining houses.  The Citadelpark and museums are also located a few minutes walk from our house.

name: Bright Apartment in Townhouse
description:
My apartment is on the first floor of an old town house situated between the Beguinage & the small streets of the Patershol. It's my favorite fallback after a long stroll in the streets of Ghent, i'm sure you'll love it like I do.

There are 2 bedrooms, a kitchenette and a bathroom. (The bathroom is private but you do have to go down the hall.)

The tramway to the train station stops just across the street. No further need for public transport, you're right in the middle of the historic center!

name: Tasteful home for cat lovers
description:
Live like a local (pet included!) in a calm neighbourhood close to the city centre, in a spacious and comfortable city home.

Charlie the 13yo tuxedo cat will be happy to welcome you on arrival! If he's at ease he may even come sleep at your feet during the night :-)
neighborhood_overview:
A residential, up-and-coming neighbourhood that is a 20-25min walk from the city’s main landmarks: Gravensteen castle, the three towers of Ghent, Graslei and Korenlei, Patershol...

If you prefer taking a bus, you'll be in the centre in 15mins tops. By rental bike, you’re there in 10!

For those who like to cook every once in a while, there are a lot of affordable supermarkets at walking distance from the house: Aldi, Colruyt, Carrefour, Bio Planet.
host_about: I've been living in Ghent for over 10 years and love to share the home I bought a couple of years back, whenever my boyfriend and I are traveling ourselves (which we love to do!). A big plus is my list of insider tips to make the most out of your stay in Ghent: great affordable food, bars, places to visit only locals go... I got you covered!

name: Central 2-BR Gem in Ghent
description:
Discover the epitome of comfort and style in our 2-bedroom apartment placed in the heart of Ghent. With ample space for up to 6 guests, this beautifully illuminated and recently renovated apartment promises a cozy retreat. The kitchen is fully equipped, and you'll find a well-appointed bathroom. What's more, a separate luxurious bathtub adds to the apartment's allure.

What truly sets this apartment apart is its prime location. Immerse yourself in the medieval charm of Ghent, where iconic attra
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

name: Le Bon Vivant
description:
This unique skipper's home has been partially completely renovated but still contains authentic elements from 1938 ( the construction of the ship). Le Bon Vivant is in a completely new piece of Ghent and contains many assets. Fifteen minutes walk you are in the medieval center of the beautiful city Ghent.

Sleeping in the skipper's house gives you a glimpse of what it must have been like to live as a skipper. It's small spaces but coziness trumps !
neighborhood_overview: Living on a houseboat in the center of Ghent means awakening to the soothing sound of water and enjoying the serene evenings with reflections of city lights on the babbling water. Experience the city in a unique way, with passing boats as neighbors and local dining options within walking distance. Life on the water in this district offers a harmonious mix of peace and urban liveliness.
