name: Exceptional Houseboat in Ghent's waters
description: Stay on our exquisite 2-bedroom houseboat in Ghent, near medieval landmarks and Gothic architecture. Ideal for families and business travelers, it offers sophisticated bedrooms, a comfortable living area, and easy city access. Experience unique waterside living with city charm at your doorstep.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

There are 3 to 4 buses per hour that will take you to the center of the city at 10 min. In addition, the house is located nearby (30 m) a large park. You can take beautiful walks, walk or bike. There is a large playground for the kids. In the park there is also an indoor swimming pool and outdoor swimming pool, wellness, fitness, restaurant, sports rooms, ... Type Lago Gent in Googel for their website
We have a comprehensive guide ready for our guests who will take you to the most beautiful and fun places within Ghent.

name: Live like a local in Ghent (2 bicycles included)
description:
Located in the vibrant Brugsepoort neighborhood, our cozy 200-year-old home is recently renovated and comfortable. Our bright and plant-filled house is the perfect place to explore Belgium’s most beautiful medieval city and located on a one-way street surrounded by beautiful parks and green spaces. We have three bedrooms, 1.5 bathrooms, and are well-suited for couples or famlies. You are welcome to use our two bikes during your stay.

Live like a local in our cheerful family home!
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood, Brugsepoort, is a diverse community where everyone is welcome and is located just five minutes by bike from the city center.  We have cafes, coffee shops, bakeries and a pharmacy, all within a convenient two block radius.  We have beautiful parks within easy walking distance that are perfect for picnics.  Ghent's best nature reserve, the Borgouyen, is an easy five minute bike ride away (excellent for trail running, family walks, and bird watching).

name: Wonderful apartment in Ghent city centre
description: Experience the very essence of Ghent from our perfectly situated 2-bedroom apartment in the heart of the city. Every advantage of being centrally located unfolds as you step outside: historical wonders, trendy boutiques, and a gastronomic journey await in the nearby lanes. Stay with us, and let Ghent's story unfold around you. Discover the city's soul, one cobblestone at a time, and make our apartment your home in this vibrant, historical city.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

name: Colorful Coziness City Apartment
description: Welcome to our Colorful Cozy city center apartment in Ghent! Located in the heart of the city, our modern Airbnb offers comfort and convenience. Explore historic landmarks, charming streets, and local cuisine just steps away. Relax in the cozy bedroom, enjoy a well-equipped kitchen, and stay connected with high-speed internet. Book now for an unforgettable stay in Ghent!
neighborhood_overview:
Welcome to the historic center of Ghent, where history and contemporary charm go hand in hand. Located on the Friday market, a square steeped in centuries-old traditions and lively atmosphere, this enchanting city offers an unforgettable journey through time.

Ghent, originally founded in the Middle Ages, has a rich history dating back to Roman times. The historic center is filled with beautiful architecture that testifies to a glorious and eventful past. Around the Friday market, you'll see countless historical buildings and monuments that reflect the character of the city.

One of the most prominent sights on this square is the imposing city hall of Ghent. With its beautiful Gothic architecture and exuberant decorations, this is an impressive symbol of the prosperity and grandeur of the medieval city. Next to the City Hall is the statue of Jacob van Artevelde, an important figure in the history of Ghent and a memory of the city as an important trade center.

description:
Feel at home in this cozy apartment overlooking the water and close to the historic center.

neighborhood_overview: "Ghent by the water" is situated in Coupure Links, in the waterfront near the Rosemary Bridge. There is a tram stop around the corner with a direct line to the Ghent Sint-Pieters train station. We are located on a bike street and on a kayak/canoe route. Also other boat rentals continue on the Coupure. A few minutes walk away are the "Watersportbaan" and "Blaarmeersen", ideal base for the traveler looking for sports and action or pure relaxation (like a beach!). Sports, relaxation and beautiful views are close by on one side, historic center and cozy streets on the other.

The accommodation is located in the historical part of Ghent at 300m from the Gravensteen and the Patershol and 700 m from the shopping center with a large number of cool cafes, coffee bars and eateries. Film Hall (Sphinx) and museums (Design Museum, MIAT, Huis van Alijn, De Kunsthal,...) less than one km .
It is a largely quiet neighborhood, but there is a wine bar next to the apartment and sometimes noisy passage from happy people, cyclists and vehicles.

name: Modern apartment with terrace in Ghent's Heart
description:
Discover Ghent from our spacious city-center apartment, accommodating 6 guests. With two cozy bedrooms, a sofa bed, and a charming patio, it's steps from attractions, restaurants, and bars. Ideal for families and friends, offering style and comfort.

Please note that you'll need to ascend stairs to reach the second bedroom.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

name: Urban Oasis for 4 in Ghent's Vibrant Centre
description: Stay in our heart-of-Ghent house, offering two bedrooms and modern comforts for up to four guests. Ideal for exploring the city and within walking distance of the top-rated attractions, this apartment is unique. Featuring a nice bathroom and a well-equipped kitchen, enjoy a homey atmosphere in this dream house, perfect for couples or small groups seeking a memorable Ghent experience.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

name: Stu@pp Gent
description:
Our studio was located in the heart of Ghent and was recently completely renovated. There is enough space for 2 people. The kitchen comes with all the necessary appliances so you can cook like at home and on our terrace you can enjoy the afternoon sun.
All facilities are there for a long and worry-free stay.
host_about:
Het aanzicht van de Meetjeslandse polders brengt bij ons een aangeboren gevoel van rust en opluchting teweeg. De polders zijn prachtig in elk seizoen. Soms leeg en desolaat als de oogst binnen is en de natuur tot rust komt. Anderzijds zijn ze een feest voor alle zintuigen wanneer de lente aanbreekt en de zomer op haar uitbundigst is. Er is altijd iets te zien voor wie de tijd neemt om te kijken.
U begrijpt: wij zijn verliefd op deze streek! Dat zette ons al ruim tien jaar aan het dromen en bracht ons er uiteindelijk toe een drietal jaren geleden aan het avontuur te beginnen dat vandaag ‘Vakantiewoning Zonnehof’ heet.

Eindelijk vonden we de geschikte locatie waarvan wij hopen dat vrienden en familie er samenkomen en kunnen genieten van de omgeving en elkaars gezelschap.
We hebben de woning zelf gerenoveerd tot een plek waar iedereen zich ‘thuis’ kan voelen.

name: Unique Apartment in Ghent's Core
description: Experience Ghent in our cozy 1-bedroom apartment, centrally located near the Belfry and charming streets. Suitable for 4, it features a welcoming interior with a modern bathroom and a comfortable living area. Immerse in the blend of history and modernity with a fully equipped kitchen and nearby dining options. Ideal for exploring Ghent's heart, it's an immersive journey into one of Europe's most enchanting cities.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!
*History & Culture*
Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.
*Nature*

Sunny 2 bedroom apartment with south-facing terrace 15min walk from the historic center.

The apartment is a 3-minute walk to Ghent-Dampoort, ideal to visit other cities such as Bruges, Brussels and Antwerp by train or bus.

The street has many shops (Aldi, Carrefour, Kruidvat, Zeeman, Hubo, bakeries, ...) and eateries (coffee shop, Turkish restaurants, fries, pizza, (vegan) pitta, ...)

I have a bike available that you can use.

name: Chic 3-BR Oasis in Ghent: Stylish Interiors
description: Relax in our 3-bedroom apartment in Ghent, combining contemporary design and comfort. Featuring a spacious living room, Falcon stove-equipped kitchen, work-friendly bedrooms, and a stylish bathroom with a shower. With two parking spaces and close to a serene lake and cafes, it offers a tranquil yet convenient stay. Perfect for leisure or work, enjoy luxury, functionality, and an ideal location.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!
*History & Culture*
Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.
*Nature*

name: Gezellig en comfortabel kattenhuis
description:
A nice place to stay within a 10-minute bike ride from Ghent city center. A friendly neighborhood that is in revaluation and full of diversity.
Tram stop: 600m, bus stop: 200m. 2 supermarkets in the immediate vicinity.

The house is photographed as it looks daily. It is stylish, cared for and tidy but living and coziness are paramount. It's not a perfectionist clean place. If you can appreciate that, welcome! You will get all the space to come and enjoy here.
neighborhood_overview:
De Bloemekenswijk is a friendly neighborhood with a wide variety of residents.
On Sunday mornings, there is a market. The Bourgoyen are recommended as a hiking spot and is not far away.

Negative: There is regular street waste that is cleared by the City of Ghent.
This place is above all a good base to get to know Ghent.
host_about:
Ik ben gepassioneerd door literatuur en poëzie. Ook de natuur is me bijzonder dierbaar (bloemen en bomen in het bijzonder). Daarnaast ben ik spiritueel ingesteld met twee voeten diep in de aarde. 
Ik woon hier met Mare, mijn zeventienjarige dochter en onze heerlijke katten.

description:
Welcome to our cottage “De Sterre” on the outskirts of Ghent. The cottage is a separate small guest house, quietly located in the middle of a large garden that you share with the owners. Ideal for you to unwind. You'll never want to leave this charming, unique accommodation.

description:
- Brand new duplex apartment for max 4 people
- only 2 minutes walk from Ghent Sint-Pieters station and easy connections to the city center
- Renewed, renovated and restored with luxury design for an ultimate stay
- Linen is included in reservation
- The apartment is equipped with every comfort, so you feel completely at home
- You can check in yourself on arrival
- Paid parking, at 80 m you can charge electrically
- Tourist tax included in reservation
host_about: Hi! My name is Donald. I’m here to go above and beyond to ensure all our guests enjoy their stay and to provide the best quality customer service possible. I’m blessed to call Ghent my home. I like to spend my free time with my family and enjoying what our beautiful city has to offer. We look forward to hosting you and providing you the best Airbnb experience!

name: Hip Flat in the Heart of Ghent
description: Welcome to Ghent, the city where medieval charm meets modern allure. Our studio accommodates up to 4 guests, featuring a comfortable bedroom and a well-appointed bathroom. Nestled in the historic center, it's an ideal base for exploring the city's enchanting cobblestone streets and discovering new adventures around every corner. Immerse yourself in Ghent's unique atmosphere – our studio is not just accommodation; it's your home in this captivating city.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this
medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and
cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century
majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic
city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral
and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an
intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine
Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late
Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the
Museum of Contempora

name: Apartfive
description:
ONLY BED. Kitchen is NOT USED and there is no WI-FI. Indeze centrally located accommodation is everything for your family at your fingertips. All the attractions within walking distance thanks to the tram and buses nearby easy to reach everywhere. You can park in every street. There are two underground parks: the Nederkouter and the Sint-Pietersplein.
The city center is located at 950 m and the Ghent Sint-Pieters station at 1,2 Kms.

name: Stijlvol appartement in Gent (Maple Garden)
description: We offer a stylish, fully furnished, and well-equipped apartment within walking distance of the UZ Ghent Hospital, close to the UGent Technology Park & only 4km from the historical centre. High-speed WiFi and TV services are seamlessly included. Forget the hassle of searching for laundry services; we’ve got you covered with an available washing machine. As part of the rental package, relish the luxury of an underground private car parking space, ensuring a completely independent stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Discover this green lung on the edge of the Ghent city centre
Maple Garden is the ideal base to drive in and out of Ghent with a quick connection to the E40 and E17. Gent-Sint-Pieters railway station is 1 km away.
Tram and bus stops are located both in De Pintelaan and Zwijnaardsesteenweg, with direct connections to Gentbrugge, Ledeberg, Melle and Zwijnaarde.
Shopping, a quick errand or an evening out? All amenities are within walking distance and the historic centre of Ghent is just 4 km.

WITHIN WALKING DISTANCE OF:
Ghent University Hospital
Technology Park Zwijnaarde
Childcare, primary and secondary schools
College and university campuses: UGent Campus Sterre, UGent Campus Ledeganck, HOGENT Campus Schoonmeersen, Arteveldehogeschool
Various supermarket chains - Delhaize, Carrefour...
Baker, butcher...
Pharmacy, (dental) doctor and physiotherapist
Restaurants, fitness, bank...

name: Kamer in Gent bij Rieke
description:
Relax in this stylish room in a cozy house on the edge of Ghent.

You have your own room with a double bed on the same floor as mine. You share a bathroom with myself. Everything is on the 1st floor.

I live in a multicultural, cozy neighborhood with lots of nice places to eat.
The center is 10 minutes by bike. Nature reserve Bourgoyen is a 5-minute bike ride away
Bicycles are provided
neighborhood_overview:
You are entering a multicultural neighbourhood. You have several Turkish shops and bakeries in the neighborhood. The neighborhood is a 10-minute bike ride from the old city center. The street is quit.
Nice spots in the Bruges gate:

Food and drink: Woest (Drongensesteenweg 22), Café Congé (Fonteineplein), Karoot (Phoenixstraat 77), Superkelly (Drongensesteenweg 2), Café De redding (Phoenixstraat 2), Café Dolfijn (Begijnengracht 34), Eetcafé De Ganzerik (Druifstraat 29), Buurthuis Trafiek (Pierkespark), Treckhostel and much more.

Culture: De Koer (Meibloemstraat 86), The dirty guests (Pierkespark), The furniture factory (Meibloemstraat 18)

Local shop: Akker en Ambacht (Meibloemstraat 86)

name: Casa Leni
description:
Bright, stylish and modern equipped guesthouse in a sustainably built home.

Included in the price: coffee and tea à volonté, fresh fruit, chocolate and use of two bikes.

We are completely equipped to host families with a baby or toddler!

The center of Ghent is close and easily accessible. Every half an hour, bus 12 takes you in 13 minutes from the village square of Drongen to the Korenmarkt (heart of Ghent). With our bikes you'll be there in 20 minutes from our Airbnb.
neighborhood_overview: The residential area Drie Leien is located in a green area, De Assels Natural Park, surrounded by three arms of the Leie. The bridge next to the church of Drongen is the only access road for cars to the Assels.
host_about: Wij zijn twee wiskundigen die werken in de wetenschapssector in Brussel. We zorgen graag voor onze twee kindjes, elkaar, ons huis, onze (schoon)moeder en de gasten die bij ons overnachten! Gezond en lekker eten vinden we heel belangrijk en dat zul je smaken in ons ontbijt. We houden van Gent en vertoeven graag in de natuur. We geven graag tips voor bezoekjes aan Gent, Brugge en de streek.

description:

https://www.airbnb.be/h/latique
and
https://www.airbnb.be/h/labelletage
host_about:
Hello, we are Jurgen & Tom
History teacher/certified guide and train manager.
Happy to have you stay with us in our house, we hope it makes you, as many others, feel at home.

When looking for dates to book, might be a good idea to look up agelandkaai online, (our landcode is be), and have a look there, you'll find special offers on restaurants, the parking policy and other extra's, like our walking tours through Gent, and what we offer on food and drinks.

You might notice that we are not available on saturdays for checking in or out. That way we keep our saturdays somewhat to ourselves (cleaning wise). Or to have time for our experience, a historic walking tour through Gent, with Jurgen as your guide.

However if you're staying for four or more days, you can always inquire to arrive or leave on a saturday. Mostly won't be a problem. You have a no, but you might get a yes…

name: House in Ghent
description: Hidden gem nearby the 13th century Turrepoort city gate of Ghent. The house is located in a very quiet car-free alley within 300m of the historic city centre. As the house has all amenities such as full kitchen, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, working desk,... it's an ideal stay for longer period as well as for a shorter city trip.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighbourhood is quiet and safe for kids to play in front of the house or to eat outdoors as the street does not allow cars to enter and is a one-way street, so no bike traffic either.

Once you leave the 100 meter alley, you have a supermarket, restaurants, bars and coffee houses within 200 meters - where you can eat Italian, Spanish, Indian, Greek, Sushi, Thai,... or have a drink at the famous bar 'Hotsy Totsy' or at the coffee place 'Labath'.

Within 500 meters, you will be at the heart of the city with the famous three towers, medieval castle and picturesque bridge looking over the canal.
host_about: We are Pascal and Annelies. We lived in China for 15 years before moving back to our hometown Ghent. I am Pascal, author and keynote speaker on Chinese innovation. My wife Annelies is a multimedia artist and works at the University of Ghent. Our daughter studies Anthropology at the University of Utrecht. We always felt home in the house you will stay. Now we live in the townhouse next door. We hope you will love the city as much as we do!

name: Zonnig nieuw gezinsappartement vlakbij Dampoort
description:
This apartment is a stone's throw from Ghent-Dampoort, in a green, hidden world: cohousing Bijgaardehof.
This unique cohousing project is built on the site of an old factory. The industrial elements are still clearly visible. The place is particularly green and quiet, and yet you are close to the city center. Neighbors are involved and share a lot with each other, but your own privacy is guaranteed. Newest techniques and well insulated. Best for family (1 master bedroom, 2 children's rooms).
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is just outside the old city center, at Ghent-Dampoort station. Many populations live next to each other. The heart of the neighborhood is located around the Dendermondsesteenweg, where you will find all kinds of supermarkets, (night)shops and (coffee)bars. There are also some parks nearby, and a large swimming pool (Pink pants).
host_about: Coördinator van een vrijwilligersorganisatie voor mensen die nieuw zijn in België. Mama van twee kindjes. Vaak op stap met vrienden en altijd wel ergens iets aan het doen. Energiek en enthousiast.

name: Stunning 2-BR Apt in Ghent
description:
Welcome to our charming apartment nestled in the heart of Ghent city! Located in the historical city center, this spacious abode offers the perfect blend of convenience and comfort for your stay.

Featuring two cozy bedrooms and a convenient sofabed, our apartment comfortably accommodates up to 6 guests. The fully equipped kitchen is perfect for preparing delicious meals, while the inviting living room provides a relaxing space to unwind after a day of exploring.

With its prime location, you'll
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

name: The Tower
description:
Spacious apartment in unique cohousing project, heart of Ghent
Discover this beautiful, bright apartment on the 7th floor of a special cohousing project, just a 10-minute walk from the historic center of Ghent. Enjoy privacy and a friendly community atmosphere.
neighborhood_overview:
Discover the bustling Dampoortwijk of Ghent during your stay in our cozy neighborhood! Located a short walk from the historic center, this lively neighborhood offers a unique blend of culture, history and local flair.

Enjoy a leisurely stroll along the banks of the Scheldt or take a boat trip to admire Ghent from the water. Visit the local markets and discover fresh produce and artisanal delicacies.

For lovers of art and culture, there are plenty of galleries and exhibition spaces to explore. Don't miss the impressive street art that adorns this site.

With its lively atmosphere and historic charm, the Dampoortwijk is a must-visit destination for any traveler looking for an authentic Ghent experience. We welcome you to explore this beautiful neighborhood during your stay in Ghent!

name: Splendid  Duplex in Ghent's Heart
description:
Welcome to our unique two-level apartment in the heart of Ghent!

On the first level, you'll find a spacious bedroom with stunning views of the city, a modern bathroom, and an open-plan kitchen and living area with a comfortable sofa bed.

Upstairs on the second level, there's a cozy bedroom in an open space.

All windows have darkening curtains for privacy and a restful night's sleep.

Experience the charm of Ghent from our special two-level apartment. We look forward to hosting you!
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

host_about: I am a father of two wonderful daughters of 28 and 25 years old. We have lived for 5 years in Washington DC before moving back to Belgium. Our passion  is traveling around the world. description:
Escape to Ghent's captivating charm with a stay in our cozy 1-bedroom apartment, designed to accommodate up to four guests with ease. Nestled near the lively Vrijdagsmarkt and the imposing Gravensteen castle, our quaint abode offers a serene ambiance and easy access to the city's historical treasures.

Relax and rejuvenate in the spacious bathroom featuring a large bathtub, providing the perfect spot to unwind after a day of exploration. Whether you're traveling with family, on a romantic retrea
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!
*History & Culture*
Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.
*Nature*

name: Historic Ghent Building - Ideal Studio Retreat
description: Immerse yourself in the lively spirit of Ghent at our chic 2 person studio nestled in the vibrant Innercity neighborhood, just a short 15-minute walk from the bustling city center. Positioned near iconic landmarks and peaceful parks, this studio provides the perfect blend of excitement and tranquility. Located in a dynamic, student-friendly area with lively bars and charming terraces, it's a sanctuary of modern comfort and convenience.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

name: Ghent's Historic Gem: Your Perfect Hideaway
description: Experience Ghent's vibrant energy in our chic studio for two, located in the bustling Innercity neighborhood, just a 15-minute walk from the city center. Surrounded by iconic landmarks, serene parks, lively bars, and inviting terraces, our studio offers the perfect blend of urban excitement and peaceful retreat. neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

name: Gezellig appartement in Gent

host_about:

Mijn woning is ideaal gelegen in centrum Gent, dicht bij station Gent-Sint-Pieters. Of je nu hier bent voor werk, studies of ontspanning, ik sta klaar om je te helpen met tips! 

Neem gerust contact op!

name: Appartement in centrum Gent
description:
Modern apartment in the heart of Ghent. Perfect for a city trip or a quiet vacation. You are within walking distance of a lot of nice places and shops.

The apartment is full of light and spacious.

Included in the price: towels, bed linen and first aid kit.

The place may have different furniture than in the pictures, but with equal quality. If you have any questions, you can always contact me:)
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is 15 minutes by tram from the station: Gent-Sint-Pieters. A 5-minute walk from the tram stop.

No parking available, but nearby you have the Sint-Michiels parking. This is also within walking distance. For a more budget-friendly option, you can place your car in Gentbrugge and take the tram via there. One can easily explore the city via public transport.

Well-known shopping streets such as the Langemunt and the Veldstraat are also within walking distance. Also within walking distance of the Gravensteen.

For even more information or distances, you can always contact us, we are happy to help you plan the perfect holiday.

name: Cozy Retreat with Sauna near Gent-St-Pieters
description: Experience a peaceful stay in our charming house near Gent-Sint-Pieters (Central Station). Accommodating up to 6 adults, it features a relaxing sauna, a quaint patio, and a kitchen perfect for breakfast. Just a 5-minute walk from the station, it offers convenience and tranquility. Recently updated, the house includes two cozy bedrooms and a welcoming living space. Ideal for exploring Ghent while enjoying modern amenities and a serene setting.
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this medieval city!
*History & Culture*
Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the Museum of Contemporary Art, Korenlei, and Kasteel van Ooidonk.
*Nature*

neighborhood_overview:
Our house is located in a green oasis, right along the Ghent harbor zone. The contrast of the greenery, the park, the tranquility and the pond opposite the past glory of old industry brings a special atmosphere to our neighborhood. In the immediate vicinity:
Beautiful castles, located in one of the green couple areas along the Ghent harbor, historic garden district "Herryville", Evergem city center a few minutes away by bike, Ghent city center is a 25-minute bike ride away.

Several supermarkets and Saturday morning market in Evergem center.

Easily accessible via R4

The house is located along the F7 Ghent - Kortrijk motorway. Within cycling distance of UZ Ghent, Zwijnaarde Technology Park, Flanders Expo and Sint-Pieters station. By car, you are quickly on the roads R4, E40, E17 and N60. The surroundings of Ghent, Brussels and Antwerp are therefore easily accessible.

name: 1597 Medieval Modern House
description:
This expertly-restored and truly-rare 138m2 historical cottage house sits in the very center of Gent on the Lei river. It was built in 1597 and won a restauration award in 1989 and is a registered monument. It has a number of original features but has been updated to modern standards.

This Medieval house has two charming waterfront bedrooms with original wooden beams and restored stained-glass windows, and one large waterfront living room with original, hand-carved bluestone fireplace.

name: Amazing Canal-Side Apartment in the Heart of Gent
description:
Enjoy a comfortable stay in a spacious 3-bedroom apartment in Gent, ideal for families or groups seeking a serene, convenient city location.

We offer EXCLUSIVELY:

✔ Self-check-in & High-speed internet
✔ Smart TV w/ Netflix
✔ 3 Comfortable rooms w/ quality beds and pillows
✔ Private bathroom w/ toiletries & shower
✔ Laundry facilities in-unit
✔ Parking options nearby
✔ €2 from each booking donated to charity
neighborhood_overview:
From your centrally-located apartment, these iconic attractions are easily accessible:

✔ Belfry and Cloth Hall: Walk or take public transport for a view from this medieval tower.
✔ Saint Michael's Church: A grand Gothic structure, reachable on foot or by public transport.
✔ Korenmarkt: A historic square with vibrant architecture, just a short walk away.
✔ STAM Ghent City Museum: Discover the city's history, accessible by walking or public transport.
✔ Museum of Fine Arts: A range of art, reachable via a longer walk or public transport.
✔ Patershol neighborhood: Historic and charming, easily walkable or a quick public transport ride.

These sites, conveniently near, enrich your exploration of Belgium/Gent, with public transport enhancing your city travel.

neighborhood_overview: Gent-Zuid is a vibrant and charming neighborhood right in the heart of Ghent, ideal for those who really want to experience the city. This neighborhood offers a unique blend of authentic architecture, cozy cafes, and local shops, all within walking distance. Gent-Zuid is known for its creative atmosphere and vibrant street life, with regular markets, art exhibitions and culinary events. name: Cozy Retreat for Two in the Heart of Ghent
description: This charming apartment in Gent is ideal for two people, combining comfort and convenience in a vibrant city location. neighborhood_overview:
With its rich history, culture, and natural beauty, Gent offers endless things to see and do.

History & Culture: Spend a few days exploring Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! Visit the famous Gravensteen castle for stunning views, or take in the Gothic and Romanesque architecture at Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church. Art lovers can’t miss the Museum voor Schone Kunsten, with art from the Middle Ages to the 20th century, and other highlights like Korenlei and Kasteel van Ooidonk.

Nature: Gent's natural attractions are equally impressive. The Bourgoyen-Ossemeersen Nature Preserve covers 230 hectares of diverse landscapes and bird species. The Ghent University Botanical Gardens showcase 10,000+ global plant species, while city parks like Citadel Park offer beautiful greenery just steps away.

Entertainment: Gent boasts a vibrant arts scene, from symphonies at Opera Gent to live jazz at Bijloke Gent Music Centre. Whatever your taste,

name: rooftop-studio topligging Gent
description:
Kick back and relax at this stylish city studio. The perfect starting point for a city trip in Ghent. Located near Gent-Sint-Pieters (5 minutes walk) and within cycling distance (or public transport) of the old city center.
You will stay on the second floor of a charming family home full of plants, warmth and worldly beauty. Overlooking greenery and in a quiet residential area.
You rent your private space: a newly built studio full of coziness and art with your own kitchenette and bathroom.

name: Studio Retreat in the Centre of Ghent
description: This cozy little studio apartment in the heart of Gent is perfect for a comfortable, minimalist stay. It features a welcoming open living space with a sleeping area and a modern bathroom, providing all the essentials in a compact layout. While it doesn’t have a separate bedroom or kitchen, its central location places you close to Gent’s vibrant cafes, restaurants, and cultural spots, making it easy to enjoy local dining options. Just a short walk from historic landmarks and shops, this studio is
neighborhood_overview:
With so many historical, educational, and outdoor attractions, you will never be bored in this
medieval city!

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and
cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century
majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic
city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral
and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an
intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine
Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late
Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century. Other notable mentions include the
Museum of Contempora

Hosting allows me to share my passion for unique stays and memorable experiences. I can't wait to welcome you and make your visit unforgettable!

description:
A beautiful room with private bathroom in a shared apartment in the heart of Gent. Only a 3-minute walk from tram station.

We offer EXCLUSIVELY:

✔ Self-check-in
✔ High-speed internet
✔ Smart TV with Netflix
✔ Comfortable bed and pillows
✔ Ensuite bathroom
✔ Shared kitchen in the building
✔ High-quality toiletries
✔ Affordable parking options
✔ €2 per booking for donations
neighborhood_overview:
For your shopping needs, several supermarkets are conveniently located within walking distance. Albert Heijn is just a 6-minute walk away, offering a variety of groceries and essentials. Carrefour Express is a bit further at 9 minutes on foot, while Seoul Supermarket, known for its diverse selection of Asian products, is an 8-minute walk from the apartment.

If you enjoy outdoor spaces, there are several parks nearby for relaxation and leisure. The Belfry of Ghent is only a 3-minute walk away, providing a beautiful setting for a stroll. Maaseikplein is just 6 minutes on foot, perfect for a quick escape into nature. For a larger park experience, Baudelopark is approximately 13 minutes away, offering ample green space for leisurely walks or picnics.

A beautiful 2-bedroom and 1-livingroom apartment with two bathrooms and a kitchen in the heart of Gent for up to 5 guests. Only a 3-minute walk from the tram station. Nearby most of the main tourist attractions in Gent.

We offer EXCLUSIVELY:

neighborhood_overview:
From your centrally-located apartment, these iconic attractions are easily accessible:

✔ Gravensteen Castle: This medieval fortress, known for its panoramic views and historical significance, is about 15-20 minutes away by tram.

✔ Saint Bavo's Cathedral: Home to the world-renowned Ghent Altarpiece, this Gothic masterpiece can be reached in 15 minutes via tram.

✔ Graslei and Korenlei: These picturesque quays along the river Leie, perfect for scenic walks or boat tours, are just 15 minutes by tram.

✔ STAM Ghent City Museum: Offering insights into the city's rich history, this museum is within a 10-minute walk.

✔ Museum of Fine Arts: Featuring a diverse collection of artworks, this museum is also a short walk, around 10 minutes from the apartment.

✔ Vrijdagmarkt: A bustling square known for its weekend markets, cafés, and local culture, is about 10 minutes by bike.

*History & Culture*

Make sure to reserve at least a few days to visit and learn more about Gent’s deep history and cultural landmarks! We recommend visiting Google’s top-rated Gravensteen attraction – a 10th century majestic castle built in a moat offering a stunning backdrop of the city. Why not also visit the historic city centre and admire the fascinating Gothic and Romanesque architecture? Saint Bavo’s Cathedral and Saint Nicholas’ Church are prominent examples of this architectural style, along with an intricately detailed interior. For art enthusiasts, the Museum voor Schone Kunsten (Museum of Fine Arts) is a must-see, containing thousands of exhibitions and preserved pieces of art from the late Middle Ages all the way up to the first half of the 20th century.
